programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stable-owner Alice and her boyfriend Ollie, travel specialists Gareth and Hihine, and newlyweds John and Katy compete over three evenings in Cambridge to host the best dinner party.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book, and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants £10,000 for his gold. Meanwhile, Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The househunters are in Norfolk, where Phil Spencer helps young-at-heart pensioners John and Peggy, who are relocating from Derby to fulfil their dream of living by the sea. With £450,000 to spend, there's an exacting list of criteria that must be met. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp assists Yvonne and Lisa, who have reached the end of their tether after spending more than a year searching for a home in a rural district.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a man searching for a home in the Cotswolds that will help him recover from a serious stroke, while also giving him easy access to the countryside and London.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Poacher Inn in South Warnborough, Hampshire, where landlady Nadia Schicchi hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Kenny Flynn hosts the first dinner party in Liverpool. His evening has a `big kids' theme, so he prepares burger buns striped like a zebra and baby octopuses that resemble spiders. His guests are Nigerian model Cynthia Umezulike, rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson, businessman Rob Spicer and fine-dining enthusiast Jilly Pollock.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his `historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model and barrister Cynthia Umezulike hosts the third dinner party in Liverpool, and hopes her meal including tribal fish, a traditional Nigerian jeloff and an exotic fruit platter will impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson hosts the fourth dinner party in Liverpool. He rustles up sticky blackened pork and an Elvis-inspired dessert of deep fat-fried chocolate bars with home-made peanut butter and banana ice-cream, but grievances among the guests threaten to derail the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jilly Pollock hosts the fifth and final party in Liverpool, inviting her fellow contestants to a black-tie event. She prepares a selection of self-styled dishes for her diners, including figs, hot beef and berry delight, and hopes an evening of ballroom dancing will ease tensions following the previous night's arguments.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with Mel and Jon, who had their hearts set on owning a piece of the Herefordshire countryside, while Kirstie Allsopp revisits outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John, a year after helping them find a property to suit their needs in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Liverpool, Kirstie Allsopp catches up with student Kate Harland, who was desperate to swap her noisy flat for something more grown up. She also revisits Kelly Price and Emma Wilcox on the Berkshire and Hampshire borders, whose house-hunting had been the cause of a few tears.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides another team of five well-known faces on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team must tackle physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes. This instalment sees adventurers Steve Jones, Scarlett Moffatt, David Coulthard, Joey Essex and team captain Jodie Kidd hope to conquer the maze, in support of the charity Stand Up to Cancer.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In East Anglia, hip-hop enthusiasts Christine and Terry provide a hearty menu for their guests, before allotment owners Tim and Amanda host with a menu dedicated to their home-grown fruit and veg. Finally, Megan and Matt - who rarely spend time together in the kitchen - set off their fire alarm and have difficulty pulling things together and getting any food to the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants £10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples who know exactly what they want and aren't afraid to say it. In the Essex countryside, Kirstie helps Tom and Lisa find a family home on a £1million budget, while in east London, Phil assists design-conscious James and Anisha, who have been searching for their first place together for almost two years.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Edinburgh's Lisa and Fiona find a home near to open spaces, and Chichester couple Charlotte and Sam, who are looking to buy their first property together.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury B&B will impress.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mushgon Dadfar hosts the first dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, and has high hopes for her Caribbean-themed evening. However, the guests have little time to let their meal settle before they face an energetic Zumba session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. As a fortysomething woman who lunches and is used to entertaining, she has high hopes that all those years of practice will make her glamorous evening a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo meet Karyn and Duncan, who have been arguing for more than two years about their three-bed semi in Stirlingshire. She wants to move on to somewhere bigger and better, while he loves the rural views afforded by their current home - not to mention the river at the bottom of the drive. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to bring them together again by helping them decide, once and for all, whether they should sell up or stay put.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on recent television programmes, from entertainment shows to documentaries, classic films and up-to-the-minute news stories.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael plans a romantic evening with Jay at an exclusive hotel, but Junior mistakenly cancels the reservation, forcing them to stay at home - where a disaster in the kitchen almost causes the house to burn down. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: Kiss or Get Off the Pot.

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the nostalgic American comedy about Eric Forman, a 17-year-old struggling to cope with all that life throws at him. Eric is delighted when his father finally gives him the keys to the family's car. Topher Grace, Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher star.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kitty plans a surprise party for Eric, but struggles to keep it a secret - and then fails to buy him a present he can appreciate. Laurie makes an impression on the guys, and love-struck Donna begins to worry things may be happening too quickly. Nostalgic comedy, starring Mila Kunis and Topher Grace.(n)

programme.title: Fletch Lives
programme.desc: Wisecracking reporter IM Fletcher inherits a crumbling plantation in Louisiana from his aunt, and spends his first night sleeping there with a lawyer - who winds up dead the next morning. Suspecting murder, he uses a succession of disguises and uncovers a conspiracy surrounding the crooked owner of a Christian theme park and the dumping of toxic waste. Comedy sequel, with Chevy Chase, Hal Holbrook and Julianne Phillips.(n)

programme.desc: Randy makes an effort to do more things that Sharon enjoys, and agrees to take her to see a hit musical in Denver. However, the show inspires him with a fanatical appreciation for Broadway, and he insists on whisking his wife away to New York to enjoy every act the Great White Way has to offer.(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry is an aspiring comedy writer living in New York City with his neurotic girlfriend. He is having difficulty getting his career off the ground, not least because of his incompetent agent and increasingly paranoid mentor. His life becomes even more complicated when his girlfriend's mother - who harbours ambitions of becoming a cabaret singer - moves in(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: A lovelorn composer flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart, only to discover she and her new boyfriend have just checked in(n)

programme.title: Singles

programme.title: The Rookie

When the veteran cop is kidnapped by the crooks, it falls upon the hot-headed rookie to save the day, putting into practice everything the old pro has taught him(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Oscar-winning World War II drama based on a true story. When German forces invade Poland, celebrated pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman loses his job because he is Jewish. As the Nazis tighten their grip on Warsaw, his family are thrown out of their home and forced to live in the ghetto. Soon conditions turn even more nightmarish, and the pianist hides in the ruined city, dodging the squads who carry off Jews to the death camps(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: Landmark drama based on the Washington Post's investigation of the Watergate break-in which led to the most significant political scandal of the 1970s. With its painstaking reconstruction of the decade's political scene and tightly-scripted view of the world of the newsroom, this film excitingly combines all the elements of investigative journalism with those of a tense thriller(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: An intense character study about two motorists whose lives become intertwined after a fender bender on a New York expressway(n)

programme.title: Tremors

As the worms begin killing off the residents one by one, two handymen become the town's only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: A drama centred on three people who are haunted by mortality in different ways. George is a blue-collar American who has a special connection to the afterlife. Marie, a French journalist, has a near-death experience that shakes her reality. And when Marcus, a London schoolboy, loses the person closest to him, he desperately needs answers. In search of the truth, their lives will intersect, forever changed by what they believe might or must exist in the hereafter(n)

programme.title: The Signal

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Controversial and often offensive stand-up comedian Andrew Dice Clay made his debut as a feature film star in this crude comedy. Fairlane is a "rock and roll detective" who works in the music business, has an office on Sunset Boulevard, and drives a 1957 Ford, with clothing to match. He floats through the rock clubs of Hollywood, picking up women and clients, and soon stumbles into a case involving the death of a heavy metal singer, a corrupt music executive (Wayne Newton), the murder of a radio shock-jock (Gilbert Gottfried), and the kidnapping of the jock's daughter (Maddie Corman). Music stars like Sheila E. and Motley Crue singer Vince Neil also have cameos in the film, which attempts to transplant Clay's aggressively obnoxious stage persona into a movie environment(n)

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order

The investigators recover bullets from the crime scene and match the casings to a gun registered to Hamilton, but the politician claims it was stolen during a break-in at his home. Guest starring Neal McDonough (Desperate Housewives, Justified).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a marine working for the Defence Intelligence Agency who was blamed for the disappearance of 500 specialised rifles in Afghanistan. programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A youngster faces a heavy sentence after shooting dead the crooked businessman who murdered his mother - until his lawyer concocts a novel defence. However, her stance provokes the anger of a local gun owners' association.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A girl is abducted on her way home from school, and inquiries reveal she has leukaemia, which had not been previously been diagnosed. programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Kristen Stewart stars in Catherine Hardwicke's adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's best-selling series of romantic fantasy novels about a teenage girl who falls in love with a vampire. When her mother remarries, Bella Swan moves to Washington State to live with her father Charlie. There, in the small, perpetually wintry town of Forks, she starts her new life, though she has no inkling of quite how different it's going to be. At her new school she quickly establishes herself as both a bit of a klutz and a hunk magnet. But she's not interested in most of the guys, apart from the moodily handsome, ashen complexioned Edward Cullen. And when he saves her from various threatening situations, their mutual attraction is sealed. There's just one problem he's a vampire. But although Edward and his undead family are 'vegetarians' who don't feed on humans, his breed find it very difficult to control their overwhelming desire for human blood when their emotions switch from love to lust..(n)

Moe is conned into marrying the dame and the trio take their revenge, Stooges style. programme.title: Airplane!
programme.desc: Jim Abrahams and David and Jerry Zucker's film, which launched a thousand imitators, remains the classic mould-breaking comedy. Peter Graves plays Captain Oveur, the stricken captain of a packed plane. Can passenger Ted Striker overcome the traumas he suffered as a wartime pilot and land the plane with the help of his ex-girlfriend, stewardess Elaine or are they all doomed? Verbal and sight gags galore lampoon every cinematic genre, with Leslie Nielsen and Robert Stack among the distinguished cast happy to make fools of themselves. And don't call me Shirley(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: Chevy Chase, star of National Lampoon's Vacation and its sequel, is back as the paterfamilias of the Griswold family (including Beverly D'Angelo as his missus) to skewer the Yuletide season. Chevy mugs, trips, falls, mashes his fingers and stubs his toes as he prepares to invite numerous dysfunctional relatives to his household to celebrate Christmas. Amidst the more outrageous sight gags (including the electrocution of a cat as the Christmas tree is lit) the film betrays a sentimental streak, with old wounds healing and long-estranged relatives reuniting in the Griswold living room. National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation was still capable of attracting an audience five years after its release -- it was one of the top-rated seasonal TV specials of 1994, outrating even the first network telecast of It's a Wonderful Life(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: A car thief is forced out of retirement to save his brother from gangsters(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Heist drama in which a man holds up a Brooklyn bank to raise money for his lover's sex-change operation and becomes the focus of the entire city's attention. Pacino gives a fine performance as the anxiety-ridden bank robber(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A female political consultant is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival, who is working on the opponent's campaign and is looking for every opportunity to antagonize her(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A martial-arts expert tracks the drug dealer whose gang was responsible for killing his sister, but he must first win a kung fu competition to get to the crime lord(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: Crew of crashed space transport tackle fellow passenger Riddick (Diesel), a serial murderer. The true threat to the crew turns out to be the planet's flesh eating nocturnal creatures(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: Will Ferrell is hilarious in this slam-dunk spoof about an inept ABA basketball team that is in danger of folding when the league announces plans to merge with the NBA in 1976. Directed by Kent Alterman(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: David Wain's comedy stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as a pair of irresponsible salesmen who find themselves acting as very unlikely role models for two wayward kids. Danny and Wheeler make their living promoting a high-energy drink to pupils as a wholesome alternative to drugs. The job fits perfectly with uber-slacker Wheeler's rock'n'roll lifestyle, while cynical Danny, whose focus is his girlfriend Beth, feels underused and that his life is dribbling away. However, neither men can find the motivation to grab life by the scruff - until, one day, they crash their truck and are given the choice between jail or community service. They choose the latter, becoming mentors to a 10-year-old breast-obsessed lad called Ronnie and teenage role-play gamer Augie. It's difficult to tell whose behaviour is worse, the children or the 'adults', but a battle of wills ensues, which will have a meaningful outcome for each of the quartet..(n)

programme.title: Chernobyl Diaries
programme.desc: An extreme vacation turns terrifying when a group of friends visit the Chernobyl disaster site 25 years later(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of professional climbers successfully scale Mount Everest only to be faced with tragedy when a monster storm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent. Jake Gyllenhaal, Josh Brolin, Jason Clarke, and John Hawkes co-star. Directed by Baltasar Kormakur (2 Guns)(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: Ron Howard helms this adaptation of Nathaniel Philbrick's historical novel about the harrowing high-seas encounter that inspired Herman Melville's Moby Dick. In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days. Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, and Brendan Gleeson co-star(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Compelling drama starring an Oscar-winning Matthew McConaughey as a macho rodeo cowboy who is diagnosed with HIV(n)

programme.title: Double Impact
programme.desc: Martial arts action thriller in which twin brothers, both expert fighters, are reunited after many years to avenge their parents' murder. After the killing, engineered by their father's unscrupulous business partner, the young sons are separated. One becomes a Hong Kong smuggler, the other a Beverly Hills aerobics instructor. But despite their very different lifestyles, they are united in the desire for justice(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this slick, entertaining spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organization that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Thriller about divers battling sharks and criminals after discovering treasure and a crashed plane loaded with drugs(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: In this hypnotic thriller, Arthur and Norma Lewis (James Marsden and Cameron Diaz) experience a crisis of conscience when they receive a mysterious box with a button inside that will grant them $1 million and kill a random person when pressed(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: It looks as though Peter Parker will retire his superhero alter- ego Spider-Man, until a wave of crime launched by evil megalomaniac Dr Octavius forces him to rethink his plans. Action(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Explosive, all-action thriller about a tough agent who guards witnesses on the federal protection programme. The agent suspects that an insider is leaking information about his latest charge - a woman with evidence of a scheme to sell off top-secret weapons. When she proves unusually difficult to protect, he realises he is also dealing with an enemy inside his own organisation(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: German terrorist, Simon Gruber plants a series of bombs in public places and gives clues about their whereabouts, through bizzare riddles. John McClane, a cop has to solve these riddles to stop the city from blowing up(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: A maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket after the latter is framed for a bombing in Paris. Soon, they combine their brawn and street smarts to investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: WWII's Greatest Raids
programme.desc: Hitler's Last Bridge. Recalling the capture of Germany's Ludendorff Bridge by American forces on March 7, 1945, after Nazi engineers bungled attempts to blow it up(n)

programme.title: WWII's Greatest Raids
programme.desc: Rangers Lead the Way. A look at the U.S. Army Rangers' D-Day mission to storm the cliffs at Pointe de Hoc and knock out the German guns that threatened the Allied invasion in June 1944(n)

programme.title: WWII's Greatest Raids
programme.desc: Mountain Massacre. A look at the Black Devils, a U.S.-Canadian commando unit trained in mountain warfare and tasked with a nighttime assault on German positions in Italy in December 1943(n)

programme.title: WWII's Greatest Raids
programme.desc: Strike From the Sky. British light infantry must take and hold two key bridges in Northern France in order to secure the beachheads and break out of Normandy(n)

programme.title: America's Most Badass
programme.desc: Guts and Glory. A series comparing the accomplishments, character and legendary status of notable figures in U.S. history begins with Al Capone, Ernest Hemingway, Benjamin Franklin and Abraham Lincoln(n)

programme.title: America's Most Badass
programme.desc: Living on the Edge. Profiles include Neil Armstrong, John Dillinger, Harry Houdini and Teddy Roosevelt(n)

programme.title: America's Most Badass
programme.desc: Players and Playboys. Profiles include Ted Williams, Elvis Presley, Ulysses S. Grant and John F. Kennedy(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: Patriots and Presidents. The birth of America and the powerful people behind it are featured(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: Discovering America. The New World's discovery; and the most famous bridge and road in the U.S. are examined(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: Fire in the Sky. A look at UFO sightings; and a pair of pioneering space flights(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: Secret Vaults and Final Journeys. The nation's secret vaults; and the sinking of Titanic are explored(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: The Great Escape. A pair of famous battles fought on American soil are examined. Also: profiles of legendary showmen(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: Striking It Rich. Economic booms and busts are examined. Also: a look at Las Vegas' most enduring myths(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: America Celebrates. A look at favorite holidays, including Christmas and New Year's Eve; a spotlight on amusement parks and world's fairs(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Tough Old Gut: Italy (1943-1944). Tracing the campaign in Italy, the area Churchill believed to be Europe's "soft underbelly." Films from national and private sources highlight the invasion of Sicily (along a front 100 miles long) and the invasion of the mainland, including the landings at Salerno and Anzio, the battle for the Monte Cassino monastery and the march on Rome. Laurence Olivier narrates(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Inside the Reich: Germany (1940-1944). Germans celebrate victories in Europe and listen to verboten foreign radio broadcasts. Later in the war, troops are stalled at Moscow, Stalingrad holds out and Hitler lives in a world of illusion. Jews are killed in concentration camps, and Count Klaus von Stauffenberg's attempt on Hitler's life fails(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Japan (1941-1945). War through the eyes of the Japanese. Footage and comments by Japanese civilian and military personnel illustrate their perspective on the conflict. Included are; clips of soldiers' farewells to families and friends, conscription of women to work in mines, fields and factories, the 1942 air raid on Tokyo by Lt. Col. James Doolittle and the defeat of Admiral Yamamoto at Midway and the training of kamikaze pilots(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Remember. Laurence Olivier narrates the acclaimed documentary series about World War II. As peace descends in 1945, the series ends with a sombre reminder of the human cost of the bloodiest conflict in history(n)

programme.title: Hitler: Fueling the Nazi Fire
programme.desc: Hitler's quest for oil to power the Third Reich leads to a campaign in the Caucasus region in the southwestern Soviet Union to gain access to this invaluable resource(n)

programme.title: Apocalypse: The Rise of Hitler
programme.desc: The Menace. Rare colour footage shows how Hitler revealed his haunting mission to save Germany. But, few would listen to the mediocre artist... until the 1929 economic crisis(n)

programme.title: Apocalypse: The Rise of Hitler
programme.desc: Marching To War. In 1933, the Nazi dictatorship extends across Germany. Hitler is now the Führer and, while publicly promoting peace, he is preparing for war(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Submarines. The cable documentary series Weaponology investigates the science of warfare as it has progressed and developed - over the centuries - from crude battlefield contraptions to diabolically inventive weaponry. Each episode hones in on one particular category of weapon and discusses its background, evolution and strategic employment on the front lines. Episode Four, "Submarines," argues that many underwater subs carry more destructive potential than any other maritime crafts, and then underscores this argument by exploring such subtopics as the modern use of nuclear-powered aquatic torpedoes, the use of subs in undercover operations, and the evolution of these clandestine sea vessels from the German U-boats of World War II to the Virginia-Class attack subs of the 21st century that can easily exterminate entire fleets of ships with a single launch(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Vertical Take Off. Explore the development of engine power, advanced avionic, target and survival systems of the vertical take-off aircraft(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: Rise of the Patriots. Director's cut of a three-part examination of the American colonies' break from England that highlights contributions by lesser-known individuals to pivotal events, and begins with Joseph Warren, a Boston doctor who sent Paul Revere on his famous ride in April 1775; Samuel Whittemore, a septuagenarian combatant in Massachusetts; and Salem Poor, a former slave who fought at the Battle of Bunker Hill(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: The Empire Fights Back. An enhanced episode profiles John Glover, a Massachusetts mariner who saved George Washington's army after the Battle of Long Island in August 1776; John Honeyman, a spy whose intelligence gathering helped tip the scales at the Battle of Trenton in December 1776; and Sybil Ludington, a teen girl who rode 40 miles to warn colonial forces about British movements in New York in April 1777(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: Return of the Rebels. In an enhanced episode, Elizabeth Burgin helps POWs escape from British prison ships in New York in 1778; Peter Francisco is known for his size and strength on battlefields in Pennsylvania, New Jersey and South Carolina; and James Armistead, a slave, serves as a spy who gathers intelligence before the Battle of Yorktown in the fall of 1781(n)

programme.title: The Revolutionary War
programme.desc: Rebels and Redcoats. The imposition of a tax on the colonies sparks protests that escalate into revolution(n)

programme.title: The Revolutionary War

programme.title: The Revolutionary War
programme.desc: Misfortunes of War. British plans to isolate New England in the summer of 1777 fail, and France and Spain provide aid to the colonies(n)

programme.title: The Revolutionary War
programme.desc: A War Without End. The years 1778 and 1779 find profiteering on the rise. Also: the growth of the American Navy; Spain's entrance into the French-American alliance(n)

programme.title: The Revolutionary War
programme.desc: The Dark Days. This three-part series chronicles the influential events of the American Revolutionary War and the people who made them happen. The series, directed by Carol L. Fleisher and narrated by Charles Kurault, aired on the Discovery Channel. Volume one contains two episodes: "The Dark Days," and "A Harvest of Victory." The first episode takes a look at the most infamous traitor in American History, Benedict Arnold, and the role he played in helping the British. The military exploits of Francis Marion, the famous "Swamp Fox" of South Carolina are highlighted. Then, General George Washington and his troops fight the decisive Battle of Trenton against British commander Cornwallis(n)

programme.title: The Revolutionary War
programme.desc: A Harvest of Victory. Examining the years 1781 to 1783, as Congress pacifies mutineers and signs the Articles of Confederation. Also: how George Washington kept the Army together(n)

programme.desc: Silent Assassin. Jeremy is in Argentina to investigate reports of a giant freshwater stingray that is killing local children. Can he solve the mystery of the deadly 'river dog'?(n)

Jeremy even considers using himself as human bait such is his determination to discover the truth behind these stories(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Growing Pains. A couple's outdated pool needs to be childproofed for their young son, but Lucas also plans to turn their ordinary patio into a stunning natural atrium(n)

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Sky High Pirate Hideout. A pirate-theme tree house is built for a couple on the Pacific coast that has a 50-foot rope bridge, heated floors and hidden compartments(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley reports from a fire station in the West Midlands to see how the emergency services deal with cannabis farms, while Rav Wilding talks to a victim of ransomware.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin visits a Leicestershire cottage, Martin Roberts is at a south London property auction, and Lucy Alexander meets two friends who have bought a bungalow in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. Si King and Dave Myers are at RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show to encourage viewers to grow their own produce. With celebrity guests, chefs and gardening experts.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A burglar takes too long when trying to steal from a laptop repair shop and a ski centre is repeatedly robbed by a sweet-toothed thief, whose trainer prints catch him out.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the red and blue teams find bargains at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, while host Anita Manning explores the city's castle.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents the latest from day one at the All England Club, with all eyes on defending men's champion Andy Murray as he begins his campaign on Centre Court against Alexander Bublik. Murray claimed his second Wimbledon crown here last year with a straight-sets victory over Milos Raonic, and starts the championships as world number one. A positive run to the semi-finals of the French Open has helped to turn Murray's season around following a slow start, and the Scot will face threats from the likes of Novak Djokovic, Stan Wawrinka and the rejuvenated veterans Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal. Other matches taking place today in the men's draw include Wawrinka v Daniil Medvedev, and Nadal v John Millman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Bus Wars
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the fierce competition between big bus tour companies in Belfast as they fight for a share of the lucrative tourist market. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Karen finds Bernadette playing truant from school, and refuses to believe her daughter's claims of being unwell. Abi tries to worm her way into Steven's affections, forcing him to remind her that what happened between them was a one-off, while Robbie struggles to establish himself with the market traders. New nanny Ingrid starts looking after Ricky and Amy, and Fi continues to make her mark on the Vic.(n)

programme.title: The Betrayed Girls
programme.desc: In May 2012, eight British-Pakistani men and an Afghan asylum-seeker were found guilty of the grooming, rape and sex trafficking of underage teenage girls in Rochdale, but it turned out that police and social services had known about the abusers for years and that the scandal went far beyond the Greater Manchester town. This feature-length documentary features testimonies from victims whose stories have not been told before and includes interviews with people who spoke out on behalf of the girls.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career, recalling his first appearance on Irish television and discussing a school reunion. There's trouble down at the Phoenix Club when Stars in Your Eyes gets cancelled, while Elton John makes a guest appearance.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan guest hosts the satirical quiz, with stand-up Joe Wilkinson and broadcaster and writer Gyles Brandreth joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham rounds off his current run with a compilation of highlights from the series. Clips feature Michael Caine, Morgan Freeman, Warren Beatty, Goldie Hawn, Patrick Stewart, Nicole Kidman, Ian McKellen, Tom Cruise, Judi Dench, Diane Keaton, Michael Fassbender and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: In Solihull, Tina Daheley reveals how West Midland Police's dog unit train their canine recruits to sniff out items, and Rav Wilding reports on DNA testing and sheep rustlers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned in Cornwall, Walsall and Hertfordshire, then talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers are joined by singer Gregory Porter, chef Matteo Salvatore shares tips on how to make seasonal pizza, and designer Adam White reveals his show garden.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Two jewellers in London are victims of an armed robbery, but the perpetrator soon becomes a fugitive in a high speed car chase. Meanwhile, three fly tippers are caught in the act.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as two teams search for antiques at the East of England Showground in Peterborough, with the help of experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents the latest from the All England Club, where day two continues, with the focus on the seeded players in Centre Court and Court One. The absence of seven-time champion Serena Williams means a break to the traditional Centre Court schedule for day two, but the crowd can still expect a galaxy of stars to take to the grass for the third Grand Slam event of the year, including matches from the top half of the ladies' draw and the bottom half of the men's draw. Roger Federer will be full of confidence following his recent tournament victory on grass at the Gerry Weber Open, and he begins his attempt to win an eighth Wimbledon title by facing Alexandr Dolgopolov, while Novak Djokovic, Milos Raonic, Dominic Thiem and Juan Martin Del Potro will also get their respective campaigns under way.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things remain tense between Sonia and Martin as they continue to argue over where Bex should live. It's Dennis's birthday but Louise's mind is elsewhere when she reveals she has had to pull out of the showcase because of what happened with Keegan - a situation Alexandra is keen to use to her advantage. Steven goes to extreme lengths to find out what Lauren is up to, Sonia and Tina reconnect, and Mick, Fi and Shirley interview for a new barmaid.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A grieving Morven won't accept the circumstances of a close tragedy and will stop at nothing to get the truth. Meanwhile, a familiar face arrives on Keller for emergency surgery, putting Sacha in a compromising personal and professional position. And when Nina makes her presence felt on Darwin, Matteo starts to see her in a new light.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: Father Michael visits the Demichelis children who are struggling to cope, but his offer of help is initially rejected by Chloe, whose anger results in drastic action. To her surprise, she gains support from an unlikely quarter. The inquest into Vernon's death begins, with Father Michael, Helen, and the officers in question all summoned to give evidence. PC Andrew Powell has to make a tough call - support his colleagues or tell the truth? And will being under oath lead Father Michael to confess to more than he has before? Drama, starring Sean Bean. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: As one of Britain's largest youth groups, the cadet forces are responsible for nearly 130,000 children in more than 2,000 clubs across the country. Katie Razzall investigates sexual abuse within these forces, and examines questions facing the Government organisation in overall charge - the Ministry of Defence.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with La-vern, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former Blue Peter presenter and intrepid adventurer Helen Skelton joins Brian Conley for a trip down memory lane, revisiting the classic archive TV that helped shape her into the person she now is. Clips include excerpts of Newsround, the early antics of Geordie duo Ant and Dec, the extreme challenges of The Krypton Factor and children's favourite Pingu.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts look back over some of the lucky finds at car boot sales and charity shops that have proved a good investment, including an exquisite Italian necklace that had been hidden away for years.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Leominster in Herefordshire, where experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant advise two teams competing to win the greater profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Lake District. Items brought in to be valued include a rare collection of signed Beatrix Potter first editions belonging to descendants of the author's solicitor, a desk that belonged to the last Russian tsar which was bought following the revolution, some Edwardian weightlifting equipment and a set of over 100 vintage firefighters' helmets.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces live coverage of the opening day's play at the All England Club, as this year's championships get under way in the men's and ladies' singles. The third Grand Slam event of the year on the hallowed grass courts is always one of the highlights of the sporting calendar, and the seeded players may be at risk of upsets as they acclimatise to the conditions after playing on clay for so long, although there were relatively few shocks on the opening day last year. Matches in the bottom half of the ladies draw are scheduled to take place today, including Johanna Konta v Hsieh Su-wei, Dominika Cibulkova v Andrea Petkovic, and Laura Robson v Beatriz Haddad Maia, while second seed Simona Halep is due to face a qualifier. The commentary team includes a number of previous winners, including Pat Cash, Boris Becker, John McEnroe, Martina Navratilova and Billie Jean King.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the opening day's play at the All England Club, where the first round got under way in the men's and ladies' singles. Much of the attention will have been on the opening match on Centre Court, which saw Andy Murray begin the defence of his title, as he aims to triumph for a third time at SW19. The bottom half of the women's draw also started, with the draw wide open in the absence of defending champion Serena Williams, who has won the title for the last two years.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Serial killer Nathaniel Dove goes into hiding deep in Hackney Marshes, where his brother Augustus intends to keep him safe until Reid's capture and incarceration have been secured. But can the assistant commissioner rely on his brother to stay out of trouble? Meanwhile, Reid is left to stew in the cavernous backstage of the Alexandria Theatre with Long Susan, Jackson and Mimi, and with so much history between the four of them, tensions begin to mount. Matthew Macfadyen and Adam Rothenberg star.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Sudan: The Last of the Rhinos.
programme.desc: The remarkable story of Sudan, the very last male northern white rhino on the planet. Snatched from his mother's side in Central Africa, Sudan became a prized exhibit in a zoo while the rest of his kind were poached to near-extinction. This programme focuses on the desperate battle to bring his sub-species back from the brink of extinction, told through the characters who have been involved in his life.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reports from Carmarthenshire, where he meets an expert on birds of prey in Carmarthenshire who uses drones designed to look like birds to train falcons to hunt. He takes a look behind the scenes in the workshop where they are built and visits a breeding unit for peregrine falcon chicks. Plus, a selection of reports from the series featuring working animals.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC Filmmaker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Gok Wan joins Brian Conley to revisit some classic television series of his formative years. From the magic and mystery of Japanese children's drama Monkey, to the pan-European quiz show Going for Gold, via groundbreaking, anarchic pop series The Tube, these were the shows that apparently helped shape Gok into the style icon that he is today.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross guide the red and blue teams around the Ardingly Antiques and collectors fair, where presenter Tim Wonnacott spots a rare pair of silver salt cellars.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Leeds Rhinos v St Helens, Castleford Tigers v Hull FC and Salford Red Devils v Huddersfield Giants.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Welwyn Garden City.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets midwife and kidney patient Sascha, who has to undergo intense dialysis sessions for hours on end, five days a week. This places the mother-of-four's body under great stress and the constant threat of blood clots gives her a life expectancy of just a few years. Determined to help, the DIY SOS team, bolstered by the local tradespeople and volunteers of Welwyn Garden City, renovate her home to include a dedicated dialysis room, offering her the chance of many more years with her family.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Jo Coburn with the latest political news, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces live coverage as the second day's play at the All England Club gets under way, with the first round in the men's and ladies' singles set to continue. Weather permitting, the line-up for the second round will be decided by the end of the day, with the bottom half of the men's draw and the top half of the ladies' taking place today. Day two traditionally sees the defending ladies' champion begin the defence of her title, but Serena Williams is absent this year due to pregnancy, so top seed Angelique Kerber will be first up on Centre Court, as she faces a qualifier. Other matches scheduled to take place in the ladies draw today include Karolina Pliskova v Evgeniya Rodina, Agnieszka Radwanska v Jelena Jankovic, and Great Britain's Katie Boulter v Christina McHale. The commentary team includes Tim Henman, Barry Davies, Peter Fleming, Tracy Austin and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the first-round matches on day two at the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year continued on the grass courts. Fifteen British players entered the main draw last year, but only five made it through to the second round, including eventual men's champion Andy Murray. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow's order of play.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at St Mary's who face a long wait, including a woman with serious mental health issues. There is also footage of patients and their loved ones coping with dementia, including a wife who is her 75-year-old husband's sole carer, and is at breaking point, partly due to his aggressive outbursts.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins in the ruinous gardens at Aberglasney House near Llandeilo before riding shotgun in the driver's cab on one of the most scenic routes in Britain. Over the border in Leominster, Herefordshire, he steps out onto the dance floor at the Lion Hotel Ballroom, where a grand ball was held to celebrate the opening of the Ludlow to Hereford railway, and finishes this leg of his journey at a traditional cider house in Hereford.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili travels to Iran, Syria, Egypt, Tunisia, Spain, and Italy to chart the scientific achievements that occurred in the Islamic world between the eighth and 14th centuries. The nuclear physicist examines the development of algebra by the mathematician Al-Khwarizmi, improvements made to medical diagnosis by Al-Razi and the regular scholarly debates organised by the ruling elite in Baghdad in the eighth and ninth centuries.(n)

programme.title: The Hidden Art of Islam
programme.desc: Rageh Omaar visits an exhibition of artefacts from the Muslim world at the British Museum, and examines artworks reflecting Hajj, the holy pilgrimage to Mecca. He discovers how Islamic artists throughout history have reacted to laws governing depictions of human figures and religious rituals, and explores the culture's tradition of figurative art.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the survival techniques used by the animal kingdom's smallest creatures. North America's Sonoran Desert is home to the grasshopper mouse, which is capable of disarming scorpions and centipedes twice its size, and displays a power and athleticism that enables it to avoid the attentions of rattlesnakes and tarantulas. In Africa, the elephant shrew, known as the sengi, employs speed to keep its distance from predators, following a meticulously constructed - and maintained - network of tiny racetracks in the savannah. The film concludes with Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, a 10-minute report on how the documentary was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Wye - Voices from the Valley: Natural World.
programme.desc: The last programme in the series documenting wildlife from around the world celebrates British countryside at its best. Cameras follow the work of a cider-maker, salmon fisherman, sheep farmer and beekeeper from the Wye Valley, who all rely on the natural cycles that vary from season to season.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili travels to Iran, Syria, Egypt, Tunisia, Spain, and Italy to chart the scientific achievements that occurred in the Islamic world between the eighth and 14th centuries. The nuclear physicist examines the development of algebra by the mathematician Al-Khwarizmi, improvements made to medical diagnosis by Al-Razi and the regular scholarly debates organised by the ruling elite in Baghdad in the eighth and ninth centuries.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins underground at Big Pit coal mine in Blaenavon, where he discovers how Victorians toiled night and day to power the Industrial Revolution. On the River Usk, he learns about 19th-century developments in angling before heading to Ascott-under-Wychwood in Oxfordshire - once the scene of a farm labourers' dispute that ended in rioting. Michael concludes this leg of his journey at Blenheim Palace.(n)

programme.title: Britain Beneath Your Feet
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Dallas Campbell takes a unique look at Britain, exploring the hidden wonders beneath people's feet. Along the way he finds out how the Shard of London stays standing on soft clay and reveals how Edinburgh was set upon an ancient volcano. The presenter also abseils down an underground waterfall higher than Niagara, canoes along a secret river under the city of Bristol and discovers a vast root system beneath one of the nation's oldest oak trees.(n)

programme.title: The Queen Mary: Greatest Ocean Liner
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of the Clyde-built ship, from the maiden voyage in May 1936 to New York, and her 1939 role in the Battle of the Atlantic, to her current status as a floating luxury hotel and museum in Long Beach, California. Among the contributors are singer Johnny Mathis.(n)

programme.title: Photographing Africa
programme.desc: Photojournalist and film-maker Harry Hook captures images of some of Africa's most remote tribes and peoples in a reflective journey across the continent where he grew up. Travelling around Kenya's Samburu district - an area approximately the size of Wales - he endeavours to track down five women whom he first photographed 30 years ago, in a bid to find out how their lives have since changed.(n)

programme.title: Roger Bannister: Everest on the Track
programme.desc: On May 6, 1954, Roger Bannister became the first man to run a mile in less than four minutes. Since that day, more people have reached the summit of Everest than have matched Bannister's feat. But as this documentary reveals, before the lunchtime-trained runner could make history, he first had to survive the Second World War. His story is told by Bannister himself, as well as his rival John Landy, Sebastian Coe, and Chris Chataway, who was Bannister's friend and pacesetter - among many others.(n)

programme.title: The Clare Balding Show
programme.desc: Clare kicks off a new series with former F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone, cycling star Mark Cavendish, stunt biker Danny MacAskill, and GB hockey players Maddie Hinch and Hollie Webb.(n)

programme.title: IndyCar Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights of the Grand Prix of Road America, round ten of the Verizon IndyCar Series. Britain's Max Chilton was looking to build on an eighth-place finish last time out in Texas.(n)

programme.title: Indy Lights Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the Grand Prix of Road America, rounds eight and nine of the Indy Lights season, the development series for the Verizon IndyCar Series.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Rally Poland, round eight of the season, continues with SS21 as drivers tackle a 18.68km route through Paprotki. Andreas Mikkelsen was the victor here last year.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: The power stage (Paprotki II) at Rally Poland, the eighth round of the FIA World Rally Championship. Sebastien Ogier won the power stage at this stage last year.(n)

programme.title: Euroformula Championship
programme.desc: Race two at round four of the Euroformula Open Championship at the Hungaroring in Mogyorod, Hungary. Harrison Scott is in control of the standings at the mid-point in the season.(n)

programme.title: International GT Open Championship
programme.desc: Race two at round four of the International GT Open Championship at the Hungaroring in Hungary. GB's Rob Bell and Shaun Balfe will be hoping to rediscover their best form.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport: DTM
programme.desc: Race two from the fourth round of the Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters at the Norisring. Drivers who have competed in this series include Mika Hakkinen and David Coulthard.(n)

programme.title: Aviva Premiership Rugby Highlights
programme.desc: Extended highlights from the opening round of matches in the 2016/17 Aviva Premiership, including Gloucester v Leicester Tigers, Saracens v Worcester Warriors and Wasps v Exeter.(n)

programme.title: FIM Speedway World Cup
programme.desc: Great Britain take on Australia, Czech Republic and the USA in round one of the Speedway World Cup at King's Lynn. GB are hoping to reach their second consecutive final.(n)

programme.title: WRC Review

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 610.
