programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles persuades Daphne's hard-drinking father to call on her mother in Seattle, hoping he can inspire them to start afresh. Meanwhile, Frasier and Roz reflect on their night together. Comedy, guest starring Brian Cox (The Bourne Identity).(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Daphne impulsively marry while holidaying in Reno, but on their return they realise Frasier, Martin and Daphne's mother will be distraught if they find out they missed the event. Starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers confront an unscrupulous car-park attendant over a matter of principle - and two dollars. Meanwhile, Daphne leaves Frasier's home for the last time, and realises how much Eddie and Martin are going to miss her. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former pub landlady Janice Gibson wants to swap her Newcastle lifestyle for a new start in the Mar Menor area of southern Spain, so Laura Hamilton shows her a selection of properties starting from around £55,000.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Newcastle, three rival couples battle it out to host the best dinner party. Partners Fiona and Hannah kick things off with their Moroccan-themed menu. Couple David and Sonia, and childhood sweethearts Claire and Steven, all agree the puppet show was unexpected. Day two sees Steven and Claire's German-inspired menu. Finally, David decides a charm offensive is needed for his and Sonia's night.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants £10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with former tennis star Greg Rusedski joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Bernie and Joy from Liverpool are determined to buy a property in Cyprus, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties in the east of the island for their £35,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a couple searching for a house in East Sussex that is far away from neighbours without being remote, as well as a woman looking for a home in the Cotswolds.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in the Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by his friend, fellow B&B owner Jeronime Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canadian comedian Larah hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Edinburgh, hoping to impress guests James, Nutan, Sindiso and Anne with a night of fine dining.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer agrees to a request from Mel Gibson to help re-edit his latest film, a remake of the James Stewart classic Mr Smith Goes to Washington - and shocks the studio executives by adding a lot more action scenes.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Milo helps Cindy to fake a robbery at The Emporium for the sympathy vote in the election, while Jesse takes Grace for a viewing at a potential new club. Elsewhere, Goldie panics when she finds out that Hunter and Simone have gone to the police station to tell the truth about Prince.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Your Cruise: Channel 4 Dispatches.
programme.desc: Almost two million Brits took a cruise last year, but how clean is the air on these holidays of a lifetime? Tazeen Ahmad goes undercover to investigate deep concerns about the impact some cruise ships could be having on the environment and public health. Travelling as a passenger on a European cruise, reporter she discovers more about the pollution levels some customers could be exposed to and investigates the wider impact of cruising holidays, from waste flushed straight into the sea to on-shore pollution.(n)

programme.title: How to Stay Well
programme.desc: Phil Kieran investigates if out-of-date make-up can leave people feeling ill, while Javid Abdelmoneim heads up the Cairngorm mountains to find out whether it is possible catch a chill from being cold. Helen Lawal tries to find out why so many struggle to sleep in a strange bed by exploring the latest cutting-edge research.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: 50 Shades of Gay
programme.desc: Rupert Everett explores the changes in gay life in the 50 years since the decriminalisation of male homosexuality in England and Wales in 1967. He meets LGBT people from all walks of life, including former royal butler Paul Burrell, rapper Jai'Rouge, actors from Hollyoaks, and Essex carpenter Steve, and visits Hebden Bridge in West Yorkshire, known as the lesbian capital of Britain.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets more people who love or loathe their body modifications, including Malcolm, who is getting a skull design scarred into his skin, and a mum with a crumbling nose job who is going under the knife again to get it fixed. Sisters Karyse and Deanna plan joint nose jobs on the same day, while Georgia wants to get rid of a tattoo she got after a night out. The programme also features a woman who regrets getting her breasts enlarged from an A to a G cup, and a man with body work ambitions that are out of this world.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team's first patient is a West Highland terrier puppy that has a problem with its paws. Two new bionic feet later, and the poorly dog has a new lease of life. A young husky collie is also brought in after being hit by a car, only for the hip replacement operation to run into trouble, and a lazy dachshund requires double surgery and lots of physiotherapy.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's Penguin Island is home to one of the most enduring love stories in the zoo. At 22, Rud is the oldest on the island, and has been with his partner, Spike, for over 15 years. However, keepers are concerned that Rud's arthritic hip could be affecting his quality of life. Meanwhile, the Sumatran tigers are upgrading to a luxury new enclosure on the other side of the zoo as part of Chester's huge expansion. But they've lived in their home for most of their lives so it's not going to be an easy move.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal which chocolates and biscuit brands to avoid when it comes to price. They look at how much it really costs to get a `free' coffee from the nation's biggest chains. The team also investigates travel insurance, and the high cost of West End theatre tickets.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr around the tasting table this time are First Dates' Fred Sirieix, food critic Giles Coren, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of smoked salmon, gin and the ready meal favourite lasagne. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test samples milk chocolate, something Brits spend around a billion pounds on each year.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Greater London examine each other's houses looking for inspiration. With advice from Amanda, they get a week and £1,000 before buyer Danny comes to view. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp tries out classic recipes for Cornish pasties and Yorkshire puddings. She also meets pig farmer Jennie Whitely, who shows her how to successfully use all parts of the animal, and finds out what goes into brawn - a meat jelly made with flesh from a pig's head.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer use their property know-how to help a couple and two doctors who are looking for their dream homes on opposite sides of the Mersey. Gary Wakefield and his wife Nicky have an extensive wish list that includes three double bedrooms, a large garden and easy access to a top-rated school in the Wirral area, but do not have a budget to match, while graduate doctors Gemma Kealty and Susannah Brown are considering spending £200,000 on a flat share in Liverpool's Sefton Park.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Fagmalion Part Two: Attack of the Clones.
programme.desc: Part two of four. Will recalls his own clumsy experience of coming out as he and Jack continue to turn Barry into the perfect gay man. Meanwhile, Grace feels abandoned when Leo offers his much-needed services as a medic in Africa.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is upset to hear Debra has been discussing intimate details of their marriage with her gossipy friends - and responds by revealing a few secrets of his own. Guest starring Maggie Wheeler (Friends).(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.desc: The shrink hopes to become the new condominium president and tries to ensure he is elected by persuading an unsuspecting Martin to stand as a `puppet' candidate. American comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz's fun-loving 20-year-old cousin visits Seattle, and Frasier finds himself struggling to keep pace with her partying. Meanwhile, Martin has trouble coping without Daphne. Long-running American comedy, guest starring Zooey Deschanel (New Girl).(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Bulldog plays a practical joke on Frasier, who wastes no time in plotting revenge. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne get caught up in a battle with a doorstep trick-or-treater. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

The rest of the team catches up with the dead man's business partner, as well as his daughter - who suspects murder and even provides a name. Chris O'Donnell and Barrett Foa star.(n)

programme.title: Stalking Elizabeth
programme.desc: After the death of her daughter, a woman tries to regain a sense of normality by returning to teaching. However, she is assigned a mentor who develops an unsettling obsession for her. Drama, starring Jes Macallan, Aaron Douglas and Nic Bishop. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Mark and Paige's secret is revealed, Leo's guest makes a move on Elly, while Terese prepares to tell Gary the news about her cancer.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo is rushed to hospital after Nate and Tori find her in excruciating pain, Justin blames Lena for Brody's drug problem and VJ struggles with Luc's custody arrangements.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Highlights
programme.desc: The Grand Prix of Germany. Action from the ninth round of the season, which was held at the Sachsenring near Chemnitz. Spanish rider Marc Marquez won last year's race on the notoriously difficult circuit, closely followed by Britain's Cal Crutchlow and Italian Andrea Dovizioso in second and third respectively.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The return after a break of the documentary following the work of officers from police forces across Yorkshire. Officers crack down on uninsured drivers whose recklessness raises everyone's premiums and kills more than 130 road users every year. In Halifax, a high-speed pursuit after one of these criminals ends in a devastating collision and foot race, while in Leeds a van courier is stopped, fails to deliver the correct paperwork to the cops, and then fails a drug test. Jamie Theakston presents.(n)

programme.title: Eamonn & Ruth: How the Other Half Lives
programme.desc: New series. Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford return to explore the extravagant lifestyles of the super-rich, beginning by heading to the largest city in the United Arab Emirates. After experiencing a luxury night under the stars in the desert, they visit the Burj Khalifa - the tallest building in the world - to meet a multimillionaire who calls it home.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the live Big Brother companion show, including a debate on the burning issues and celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Botched Up Bodies
programme.desc: TV presenter Gail Porter has always hated her breasts, which are too large for her tiny frame, so she visits surgeon Paul Harris to see if anything can be done. Life on Marbs star Natalie Richardson also seeks help to sort out her nostrils, which were left uneven after surgery on her nose, and experts consider what work former model Janice Dickinson has had done over the years.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Cameras continue to observe three families who were given £26,000 in return for coming off benefits. In Hull, Tony and son Michael start buying stock for their secondhand business, including two large slot machines. In Liverpool, Scott and Leanne go through their business plan, and elsewhere in the city, single mum Rachel talks to her friend Mary about how to look for a job when you have never had one.(n)

programme.title: My Mum's Hotter Than Me
programme.desc: Aimi loves being a stripper, much to the embarrassment of her 20-year-old son Harry, while Margarete and her two daughters go to extreme lengths as they try to outdo one another in the beauty stakes. Plus, pensioner Anne turned to glamour modelling in her sixties and is determined to be a centrefold star, while beauty blogger Sal is spending thousands of pounds on cosmetic surgery to look better than his boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Design guru Ann Maurice visits a house with an unsightly pile of brick rubble, investigates a property whose garden is a potential death trap, and delivers her verdict on a conservatory used to store laundry in this compilation of highlights from the series.(n)

programme.title: House Busters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and her team of new-age practitioners suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Bump tries on new shoes, and Mr Fussy directs the Dillydale version of Cinderella.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: Mogu comes across a large black crow, so Kerry builds a scarecrow to stop the bird eating all the cherries on the trees.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The cheeky piglet helps Grandpa Pig carve his pumpkin. However, it is so big they worry they might not be able to get it to the pumpkin competition.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster is upset when a leg falls off her teddy bear and she is frightened to play with it in case it breaks again.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pup and the Very Big Baby.
programme.desc: The team works together to save a beached baby whale that has become stranded on Adventure Bay, and reunite it with its mother.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo dreams of becoming a cowboy when Bob and his team build stables at the racetrack.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman's plan to win the three-legged race by cheating backfires when he falls down a rabbit hole and hurts his ankle.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Dash is rewarded for being a really useful engine, and his prize is to spend the day with Toby.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The girls explore an ice palace in their search for a magical gem.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Lost Race.
programme.desc: Revs unexpectedly slows down during a race, and when Noddy tries to find out why, he discovers that Revs was hoping to find a friend.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Marshall makes friends with a gosling that he names Fuzzy, but the bird will not leave when it is time for his flock to fly south.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The King declares no one is allowed to celebrate his birthday because he does not want to get any older.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: When Digby tells his friends that they need to go to Peek Rock to see a special event, Grizel and Mungo decide that they have to get there first.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George want to be famous detectives, so Daddy Pig gives them a mystery to solve.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: When a baby meerkat escapes into Wissper's home her mum's animal allergy is ignited. so Wissper summons Dan the wise old panda for advice.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The duo explore Quome on a hoverboard and soon realise Wanda's little sister has secretly joined them for the ride.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro helps the owner of a canal boat to make her narrowboat more attractive to would-be buyers, with the vessel having been on the market for five years.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo undergoes emergency surgery, while Kat makes further progress in the drugs case, but Ash wants her to spend more time at home. Brody goes cold turkey, but starts hallucinating.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Mannix leaves Leo no choice but to enlist David to help with his knife wound, Amy discovers Jack still has feelings for Paige, while a concerned Paul connects with Terese.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks is forced to resume an old alias he hates in a bid to protect his best friend and chief informant from arms traffickers who want him dead. Crime drama, starring Eric Christian Olsen, Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Presumed Dead in Paradise
programme.desc: A teenager is invited to spend a holiday on a Pacific island with her stepmother, and seemingly drowns. She survives her brush with death and swims to shore, only to discover her stepmother may have arranged the accident. As she investigates, she uncovers a sinister conspiracy with links to her dead father. Thriller, starring Malese Jow and Olivia d'Abo. Edited for violence.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Mannix leaves Leo no choice but to enlist David to help with his knife wound, Amy discovers Jack still has feelings for Paige, while a concerned Paul connects with Terese.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo undergoes emergency surgery, while Kat makes further progress in the drugs case, but Ash wants her to spend more time at home. Brody goes cold turkey, but starts hallucinating.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: FIA World Rally Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the Rally Poland, the eighth round of the season, which was based in Mikolajki - north of Warsaw in the Masurian lake district. The predominantly flat roads were expected to lead to high speeds in a rally that was first established in 1921.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Inspector Helen saves Turner and Hooch, two Dogues de Bordeaux found abandoned in a garden, while colleague Becky sets off to track down a hound who was spotted stranded in a flood relief channel. Cameras also follow Pepper, a dalmatian who is stealing hearts across Merseyside, and Shih-tzu Olive, who was found in pain on a building site.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Near the historic city of Bath, business partners Rowena and Mike are running a boutique hotel that is on the brink of going under. Operating the property more like a home than a hotel, Rowena's hospitality means the business is running at a huge loss, so Alex Polizzi attempts to teach these hoteliers how to turn a profit from their customers.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The sleepy appearance of an Appalachian coal-mining community belies the presence of a sinister toxic waste-dumping scheme that is poisoning local plant and animal life as well as area residents. The murder of an environmental protection agency investigator leads officials to assign Jack Taggart (Steven Segal) to go undercover as a handyman working through a relief mission. It doesn't take him long to discover that the mastermind of the dumping is local businessman Orin Hanner (Kris Kristofferson). Along the way, Taggart falls for the mysterious Sarah Kellogg (Marg Helgenberger), a young woman ostracized for a sordid past and a father who died under suspicious circumstances while working for Hanner. When Taggart's undercover work proves ineffective, he provokes a direct confrontation with the villain and his henchmen that results in plenty of Segal's trademark martial arts action. In addition to kicking the stuffing out of bad guys, Segal demonstrates a real knack for playing bluegrass guitar(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: This involving drama stars Vincent Gallo as the title character, an ill-tempered, brooding poet living in Argentina, who is visited by his younger brother after a long estrangement during which the younger brother thought Tetro might be dead. The two discuss their troubled relationship with their composer father and attempt to find some common ground. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified..(n)

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: When a computer whiz-kid taps into the government early-warning system, it invites him to play 'Global Thermonuclear Warfare'. Little does he realise that this is not a variation on Space Invaders, and his gleeful decision to nuke Las Vegas precipitates a full-scale countdown to Armageddon(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romance writer finds a real-life hero and novel escapades while tracing her kidnapped sister(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In 1820s America, frontiersman and fur trapper Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his teenage son Hawk (Forrest Goodluck) join a pelt-gathering expedition. However, their party are attacked by Arikara Native Americans, who kill a number of the men. Glass then tries to lead the remainder of the group to safety, charting a new path to a U.S. fort. Unfortunately, he is soon mauled by a grizzly bear while hunting for food, and is horribly wounded. He is left in the care of roughneck John Fitzgerald (Tom Hardy) and the young and inexperienced Jim Bridger (Will Poulter), while Hawk watches on in horror. Fitzgerald betrays him and leaves him buried alive in a shallow grave, but Glass nurses himself back to health and sets out to seek revenge. Alejandro González Iñárritu directed this pulse-pounding epic(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds
programme.desc: When a detective's fiancee is kidnapped by an ex-con, he must successfully complete 12 challenges in order to secure her safe release(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: John Moore's remake of the 1965 classic stars Dennis Quaid as pilot Frank Towns who crash lands his plane in the Gobi desert with a mixed package of passengers and no hope of rescue. Giovanni Ribisi plays Elliott, the enigmatic engineer who persuades the survivors they can scavenge enough from the crashed plane to build another to fly them to safety, while a love interest is provided by Miranda Otto as the tough yet vulnerable Kelly. Superbly photographed by Brendan Galvin, this stands against the original, with the mix of characters providing the drama and the take-off of the cobbled-together aircraft a nail-biting climax(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Al Pacino plays an old-school coach in Oliver Stone's hard-hitting look at pro football. Jamie Foxx costars as a second-string quarterback who's thrown into the starting lineup when the team's veteran signal-caller (Dennis Quaid) is injured. NFL greats Jim Brown and Lawrence Taylor have significant roles. Cameron Diaz, James Woods, LL Cool J(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: In this haunting thriller, a young woman searches for her twin sister in an infamous Japanese forest beneath Mount Fuji where lost souls go to commit suicide. With the help of an American guide, she treks into the heart of the mysterious woodland(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Ghost story about a divorced woman and her daughter who move into a creepy apartment building off New York City's East River. The haunting conditions force the residents to examine the history of the building's former tenants(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: An ex-convict tries to go straight, but while running a nightclub his drug-addicted lawyer and an ambitious young criminal make it difficult for him to get out of the life. Meanwhile, he tries to win back the woman he loves who doesn't trust that he's trying to stay on the right side of the law(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Wyatt Earp is a movie about a man and his family. More of a documentary than a Hollywood tinsel, this movie shows us the good times and the bad times of one of the West's greatest hero's(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: The autobiographical recollections of writer-director Barry Levinson recount the story of five high-school grads on the brink of adulthood in 1959 Baltimore(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: NYC cop John McClane fights terrorists in an L.A. high-rise in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages. Meanwhile, the terrorists attempt to steal $600 million from a high-tech safe(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a pair of idiotic friends who set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner. However, they are blissfully unaware that the case contains a large amount of ransom money for the owner's kidnapped husband. Their trip is soon fraught with disaster, especially when the kidnappers begin to pursue them across the country with the aim of grabbing the cash(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Benjamin Franklin Gates (Nicolas Cage) descends from a family of treasure-seekers who have shared an unusual quest. As Gates-family legend has it, George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and Benjamin Franklin hid a massive cache of gold during the waning days of the Revolutionary War. Ben's close to discovering its whereabouts, but the FBI and his competition are also hip to the hunt(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: Mel Brooks parodies the films of Alfred Hitchcock -- particularly Vertigo - with High Anxiety, in which the comedian plays Richard Thorndyke, a psychiatrist with a fear of heights who discovers a plot to drive wealthy patients crazy(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: Mel Brooks and his wife Anne Bancroft co-star in this funny remake of a 1942 comedy of the same title, based on a story by Ernst Lubitsch and Melchior Lengyel about a down-and-out Warsaw theater troupe who save the Polish resistance fighters from the SS in World War II. Frederick Bronski (Brooks) leads a struggling theatrical company that offers anything -- from excerpts of Hamlet to stock vaudeville -- if it will pull in an audience. Unknown to Frederick, his wife Anna Bronski (Anne Bancroft) starts up an extra-marital interest in a Polish pilot (Tim Matheson) that could lead to a large-scale disaster. The pilot unknowingly reveals the names of the Bronskis and several resistance fighters to an SS spy (José Ferrer), and by the time he finds out what he has done, he is in London, so he is forced to return surreptitiously to Warsaw as fast as he can to stop the list of names from landing in the hands of the SS chief (Charles Durning). Once the theater troupe is called in to help on this mission, the comedy begins in earnest with the actors donning the guise of Nazis, and Anna seguing into "seductions" of the SS spy and his chief as a part of their battle plan(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. Everything goes according to plan until a pregnant Poehler shows up on Fey's doorstep with no place to live, and suddenly two very different women are joined together to create a very unexpected family(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson and Antonio Banderas make genial sparring buddies in this bright comedy-drama. They play pro boxers who are slightly over the hill, but have a chance to redeem their careers---if they fight against each other in a Las Vegas match. Lolita Davidovich, Lucy Liu, Tom Sizemore, Robert Wagner, Richard Masur. Directed by Ron Shelton ("Bull Durham")(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: Mel Brooks and his wife Anne Bancroft co-star in this funny remake of a 1942 comedy of the same title, based on a story by Ernst Lubitsch and Melchior Lengyel about a down-and-out Warsaw theater troupe who save the Polish resistance fighters from the SS in World War II. Frederick Bronski (Brooks) leads a struggling theatrical company that offers anything -- from excerpts of Hamlet to stock vaudeville -- if it will pull in an audience. Unknown to Frederick, his wife Anna Bronski (Anne Bancroft) starts up an extra-marital interest in a Polish pilot (Tim Matheson) that could lead to a large-scale disaster. The pilot unknowingly reveals the names of the Bronskis and several resistance fighters to an SS spy (José Ferrer), and by the time he finds out what he has done, he is in London, so he is forced to return surreptitiously to Warsaw as fast as he can to stop the list of names from landing in the hands of the SS chief (Charles Durning). Once the theater troupe is called in to help on this mission, the comedy begins in earnest with the actors donning the guise of Nazis, and Anna seguing into "seductions" of the SS spy and his chief as a part of their battle plan(n)

programme.desc: Avalanche. This video contains exciting footage that makes it one of the Discovery Channel's most popular films in its Raging Planet series. Watch as avalanches slide into action, spreading their doom once snow-packed areas begin to shift. Listen and learn how avalanche controllers can use a cannon to purposely trigger certain snow slides in an effort to prevent uncontrolled avalanches. Viewers will be fascinated to watch as some avalanche controllers even climb aboard helicopters and then drop explosives on unstable snowpacks in an effort to protect both humans and the surrounding environment. Meanwhile, Louis also breezes back into Glenbogle, intent on wooing Molly, and Golly revamps his image. Alastair Mackenzie and Lorraine Pilkington star.(n)

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James must break the sad news that a dog owner's beloved pet is blind, and Tristan is given an ultimatum by Siegfried. Christopher Timothy, Peter Davison and Robert Hardy star.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: On Will Fletcher's last day at Sun Hill, Mickey questions a man accused of assaulting a doctor who he claims is having an affair with his wife. The suspect turns out to be severely depressed and unbalanced, but Callum's macho handling pushes him further toward disaster when he disappears with his baby son in his car. Realising his error, the sergeant tracks him down, only to see the distraught man deliberately smash into a parked vehicle, setting his own car alight.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A 16-year-old claims she has been gang raped by her boyfriend and three of his friends, and Jo goes out on a limb to fight her case, even when it becomes clear the victim is not the innocent she at first appeared. When the girl later asks to drop the charges after receiving threatening telephone calls, Jo begs Terry for more time to extract a confession, determined not to let the arrogant youths get away with their crime.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio hatch a cunning plan to try to persuade a tight-fisted pub-goer to buy a round of drinks at the local.(n)

programme.sub-title: How to Go on Holiday without Really Trying.
programme.desc: Hyacinth makes expensive vacation plans and discovers that voluntary church cleaning is certainly no holiday. Meanwhile, Rose ends up in a compromising position. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Mary Millar.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An outing to see Dwayne's favourite group is cut short by the murder of the lead singer, who was not exactly popular. He regularly annoyed his bandmates with his pre-performance relaxation routine, which involved lying in a coffin below stage for 15 minutes - prompting Richard and Camille to wonder whether it was enough for any of them to want him dead for real. Caribbean crime drama, guest starring Keith Duffy, Ray Fearon and Robbie Gee.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A former sex kitten tells a tabloid newspaper all about her promiscuous past, much to the disgust of villagers, and later suffers a tragic accident that leaves her in a coma. Shortly after, she is spotted making her way to church, remorseful and ready to seek forgiveness for her sins. Jonathan and Maddy are baffled but not convinced that her recovery has a supernatural explanation. Emma Kennedy guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a murdered drug-runner who seems to have returned from the dead to exact vengeance on his killers using the power of voodoo. Offbeat drama, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin and Stuart Milligan, with a guest appearance by Jonathan Ross.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The Secretary of State for Northern Ireland and his two daughters are killed by a car bomb and a British Army base is attacked. Amid a national outcry, an Irish terrorist group deny responsibility for the second bombing and a Bosnian war criminal is spotted entering the country, prompting the team to suspect a revenge campaign is under way. Matthew Macfadyen, Natasha Little and Keeley Hawes star.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Reports of extremist activity at a Birmingham mosque alert the team to the existence of suicide bomber training. When one MI5 agent is exposed as an infiltrator and tortured, help arrives in the form of an Algerian spy. But when a terrorist outrage is planned, it becomes a race against time to identify the target before his cover is also blown. Guest starring Alexander Siddig, best known as Dr Bashir in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, with Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An intruder detained in a couple's flat turns out to have been there before, though the residents claim to have no idea who he is. Jo discovers the suspect works as a security guard in the same building as the woman, and investigates the theory he has been stalking her, but extracting a confession puts her in a tricky position. At the end of an arduous shift, she discovers her hard work is to be rewarded with promotion to sergeant. Guest starring Kara Tointon, Barry Sloane and Gareth David-Lloyd.(n)

programme.sub-title: Ballad for Wind Instruments and Canoe.
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a canoe and decide to take it for an unauthorised trip up the river - but things soon start to go wrong. Meanwhile, Ivy wins a prize for having the best mouth-instrument.(n)

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon gets a passion for democracy - and decides to buy Darryl's vote from Tracey for the local by-election. Robert Llewellyn guests stars, with Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.(n)

programme.desc: Richard finds time weighing heavily on his hands, so Hyacinth decides to provide him with a hobby - a move that backfires on her in spectacular fashion. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Joan Hickson, in the guise of super-sleuth Miss Marple, receives a cryptic letter from a recently deceased acquaintance asking her to conduct a mysterious investigation. Instructed only to go on a coach tour of historic homes around England, she uncovers murder and intrigue. Feature-length mystery, also starring Peter Tilbury, John Horsley and Helen Cherry.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a murdered drug-runner who seems to have returned from the dead to exact vengeance on his killers using the power of voodoo. Offbeat drama, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin and Stuart Milligan, with a guest appearance by Jonathan Ross.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The unconventional hero investigates the puzzling murder of a policewoman, with the only clue to her bizarre death being reports of a stranger in a coonskin hat at the scene of the crime. Hired by a ruthless TV producer to locate the culprit, he discovers the mysterious man is not all he seems - but is soon distracted by the intervention of old acquaintance Carla Borrego. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Famously Single
programme.desc: Date Marry Dump. In the Season 2 premiere, eight single celebrities enter an opulent L.A. loft to get help from relationship expert Dr. Darcy Sterling. But immediately tensions flare between the celebrities and a romance begins to blossom(n)

programme.title: Famously Single
programme.desc: Let's Do Some Damage. Chad opens up to Dr. Darcy about his villainous ways. And later, the singles challenge their comfort zones as they set out to fill a party bus with other singles for a party back at the loft. That is, until Calum decides he's had enough(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed & Fabulous
programme.desc: In this charming sequel, an FBI agent's newfound celebrity interferes with her undercover work. This time out, her big case involves finding a kidnapped beauty-pageant winner(n)

programme.title: Bring It On Again
programme.desc: Whittier (Anne Judson-Yager) arrives at the fictional California State College hoping to join the national champion varsity cheerleading team. She meets up with her friend from cheerleading camp, Monica (Faune Chambers), and they're both impressive at the tryouts. Head cheerleader Tina (Bree Turner) is ready to ask them to join the team, but Dean Sebastian (Kevin Cooney) goes a step further, telling Tina that Whittier will be the next head cheerleader. This angers Tina's pal Marni (Joie Lenz), who had the position staked out, but Tina goes along with the plan, taking Whittier under her wing. Whittier meets Derek (Richard Lee Jackson), a campus deejay who immediately takes a shine to her. But Tina is very demanding and controlling. She warns Whittier that Derek is not the type of boy she should be dating. Monica is bothered by Tina's meddling, but Whittier momentarily lets her cheerleading ambition get the better of her, and breaks it off with Derek. Then Tina, upset with Monica's sassy attitude, forces Whittier to choose between her friendship and the squad. Whittier and Monica get fed up and quit the team, but Whittier's school spirit cannot be suppressed. With Monica's help, she gathers up the outcasts from the drama club, the dance club, and other groups that have lost their funding and forms a ragtag squad of her own, determined to battle the varsity squad for a spot at the national championship. Directed by Damon Santostefano (Three to Tango), Bring It On Again was released straight-to-video; aside from its subject matter, it has no direct connection to the original Bring It On(n)

programme.title: Bring It On: In It to Win It
programme.desc: Southern California high school senior Carson arrives at the all-important Cheer Camp Nationals determined to lead her squad(n)

programme.desc: Break out the pom-poms for this fun flick! Feisty East Los Angeles high cheer-squad captain Lina Cruz (Christina Milan) and best friends Gloria (Vanessa Born) and Tryvonetta (Gabrielle Dennis) have their hopes set on winning the Spirit Championships with hot Latin and hip-hop moves and a little bit of luck. After her mother's remarriage, however, Lina is forced to relocate to a new school and is faced with the task of turning the far inferior Malibu Vista High Sea Lions into a winning squad(n)

programme.desc: Binky puts her heart on the line and asks JP if they have a future together, the girls ask Jess to explain her flirty behaviour with Jamie, while Lucy has shocking news.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta takes part in an undercover FBI operation that ends in a mass arrest. But when one of the mobsters escapes he enlists Boyle's help in tracking him down. Captain Holt tests the squad's patience with practice drills in which Sgt Jeffords plays different roles, while Gina pleads with Boyle to keep a secret. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt is taken by surprise when his long-time nemesis, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch (guest star Kyra Sedgwick), arrives to carry out an inspection of his precinct. Peralta and Jeffords test the boundaries between `work friendship' and `real friendship' while they investigate a stabbing at a trendy milk bar. Boyle searches for a guest to take to his ex-wife's engagement party - will Diaz come to the rescue?.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Elena faces being deported, so Joe offers to marry her so she can stay in the country. Mel refuses to take part in the scheme, but when things begin to go wrong she is forced to protect the couple. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Joe starts to search for another job as he realises Lennox and Ryder are old enough to look after themselves, however Mel does not want him to go and tries to show him how important he is to her and her family. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Now that she knows the truth about Margot, Riley decides to look for her biological father too, and uses her parents' high-school yearbook as a guide. With a little help from Ben, she narrows down the possible candidates to an easy-going pastry chef and a high-flying lawyer. Comedy, starring Chelsea Kane and Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley looks forward to meeting Philip's sister when she visits from England, but her excitement vanishes when it becomes clear his sibling is unimpressed with his taste in girlfriends. Meanwhile, Danny's contract negotiations with the Rangers are put in jeopardy. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Captain asks Lily to move to Rome for a year so she can continue to act as his consultant while he lives there, but she is afraid Marshall will feel resentful toward her if she accepts. Meanwhile, Ted and Barney are captivated by the idea of seeing a woman's figure as it is always hidden beneath a large coat. American sitcom, guest starring Kyle MacLachlan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin tries to find her `something old', which she buried in Central Park years previously in preparation for her potential future wedding. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily ask Ted to help them pack for their trip to Italy, and Barney bonds with Robin's father.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess invents a male alter ego to help her buy a new car from a sexist salesman, but her plan backfires. Schmidt and Cece worry when Winston decides to bring his prankster girlfriend Rhonda along to their wedding. Sonequa Martin-Gree (The Walking Dead) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Schmidt suffers an emasculating experience in front of Cece, so he insists on taking a manly road trip to Las Vegas for his bachelor party weekend with the guys. However, an incident at a biker bar in the desert puts Schmidt's new-found bravado to the test.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Boyle go on an eight-day stakeout, which puts a strain on their friendship. Meanwhile, Jeffords uses Santiago and Gina for inspiration when he writes a book about his daughters, and Captain Holt's nephew visits Brooklyn and makes an instant impression on Diaz. Comedy, guest starring Kyra Sedgwick and Nick Cannon.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The team visits Boyle's beach house on a detectives-only getaway, but Peralta ruins the fun by inviting Captain Holt along. The host helps Diaz to send romantic texts to her new boyfriend Marcus, while Gina amuses herself by trying to get Santiago drunk. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While the girls go to Disneyland and get made up as princesses, the guys have to promote science as a career option for women at Howard's old middle school. Meanwhile, Raj and Lucy have their first date in a library, where instead of speaking to each other they send text messages.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldon's Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitz's cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howard's father, who hasn't made contact in years.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin is upset to discover her mother cannot attend the wedding. Meanwhile, the gang thinks back six months to when Barney accepted a series of romantic challenges from Lily and Robin, and ponders the nature of the ever-changing love triangle between Ted, Robin and Barney. Guest starring Bryan Cranston.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney becomes convinced he can reunite his parents after seeing them together for the first time in years - but does not realise his brother James has something else in mind. Meanwhile, Ted investigates when a gift Barney planned to give to Robin is ruined. Guest starring John Lithgow and Wayne Brady.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess invites Paul, a fellow teacher she has a crush on, to the gang's Thanksgiving dinner party, but the proceedings do not go according to plan. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel, with Justin Long (He's Just Not That into You).(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess is desperate to find space where her handbell quartet can practise, so she brings the members to the flat - where things take an unexpected turn when Winston reveals his hidden musical talents. Meanwhile, Nick and Schmidt become embroiled in an increasingly heated argument over DIY. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel, Lamorne Morris and Jake Johnson.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline's cupcake shop is boycotted after they refuse to sell cupcakes to I, an artist who wants to put cocktail sausages in them.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Han believes that his staff at the diner are not working together properly as a team, so he arranges a mandatory night out to help them bond.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friend's sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Myra is furious to hear that Goldie is considering going on the run and orders her to go to court instead. Meanwhile, Cindy and Simone go head-to-head at the charity Walkathon, and Warren is spooked when Myra mentions Bart.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After finding out there is only going to be one Hanukkah song in the holiday pageant, Beverly convinces Erica to create the perfect song.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newhart) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Binky & JP's Baby: Born in Chelsea
programme.desc: Part one of two. Following the Made in Chelsea stars as they become parents, charting the last nerve-wracking weeks of pregnancy and climaxing with the arrival of their daughter.(n)

programme.title: Vlogglebox
programme.desc: Reactions to Barney from Napalm Death introducing Ed Miliband to death-metal singing, as well as viral videos of male seahorses giving birth and an interview with Boris Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover actress Summer Glau is on their train while travelling to San Francisco. Desperate to discuss the Terminator TV series with her, the friends devise a number of plans to engage her in conversation. With Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they watched during November, 2015. Programmes eliciting their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions include The X Factor, Colour: The Spectrum of Science, I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, Simply Nigella, The Hunt, First Dates and the news.(n)

programme.title: Binky & JP's Baby: Born in Chelsea
programme.desc: Part one of two. Following the Made in Chelsea stars as they become parents, charting the last nerve-wracking weeks of pregnancy and climaxing with the arrival of their daughter.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Receptionist Kirsty has high expectations for her date with Oliver and wastes no time in telling him that she wants marriage and kids very soon. DJ Tom struggles with confidence away from his decks and is matched with classics student Olivia, who has never had a date before.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Nick tries to keep cool when Reagan (Megan Fox) moves back into the loft. Cece and Winston challenge Schmidt's love of electronic dance music.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess is shocked by Robby's medical bills and goes to extreme lengths to pay them off for him. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Now that she knows the truth about Margot, Riley decides to look for her biological father too, and uses her parents' high-school yearbook as a guide. With a little help from Ben, she narrows down the possible candidates to an easy-going pastry chef and a high-flying lawyer. Comedy, starring Chelsea Kane and Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley looks forward to meeting Philip's sister when she visits from England, but her excitement vanishes when it becomes clear his sibling is unimpressed with his taste in girlfriends. Meanwhile, Danny's contract negotiations with the Rangers are put in jeopardy. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Milo helps Cindy to fake a robbery at The Emporium for the sympathy vote in the election, while Jesse takes Grace for a viewing at a potential new club. Elsewhere, Goldie panics when she finds out that Hunter and Simone have gone to the police station to tell the truth about Prince.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The tourists visit Benidorm, where Brendan takes the group circus training before they spend the afternoon jet skiing. Later on, emotions run high at the vote and there is a surprise in store for the passengers.(n)

programme.title: Made in Chelsea LA
programme.desc: The group get ready to leave Los Angeles. Following JP's crushing rejection, heartbroken Binky seeks comfort in the arms of an old friend back in Chelsea.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad has time to kill when the arrival of the Serbian president's motorcade to Brooklyn is delayed, so Peralta launches the seventh annual Jimmy Jab Games, an eccentric series of races and contests held in the precinct building. Meanwhile, Jeffords and Holt must set up a new drug task force approved by Holt's nemesis, Madeline Wuntch.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: It's Halloween again, and this time Peralta bets Holt he can steal his treasured watch before midnight, enlisting criminal assistance to achieve his goal. Elsewhere, Gina struggles to keep up with her college course, perform a full-time job and attend dance rehearsals - leading to problems both in and out of work.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel dates a divorced man whose ex-wife is going out with Joe, and a disagreement arises over custody of the former couple's son. Meanwhile, Lennox is tempted to get a tattoo, and Ryder is surprised to find he misses being in school.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: When Joe lands a job at City Hall, he gets caught up in another potential financial scandal, which could put Mel's career at risk. Meanwhile, Lennox is torn between her boyfriend Zander and Archer, her good-looking co-star who has to kiss her in the school play. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley gives Ben and Danny the time capsules they made at school, which causes everyone to reflect on what they have achieved in their lives so far. Meanwhile Bonnie is not happy when some unwanted attendees turn up at her dance class. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben is disappointed when he misses Emma's first steps so Bonnie, Tucker and Riley try to recreate the moment for him. However, the activity causes the group to contemplate how much their lives have changed since the child's arrival. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: With their wedding looming, Robin and Barney try to relax at a restaurant, but plot revenge on a couple who ruin their evening. Ted invites Lily to see the house he has been renovating in the suburbs and shares his plans of moving to Chicago after the ceremony. Meanwhile, Marshall takes Marvin on a last-minute trip to Minnesota to see his family before leaving for Rome.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The gang travels to Long Island to attend Robin and Barney's wedding, but the couple make a startling discovery about their families en route. Meanwhile on his way back from Minnesota, Marshall realises his mother has posted a picture online declaring he has accepted his dream job before consulting his wife, and Lily realises that Ted hasn't dealt with his feelings for Robin. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: The wedding is looming, but Jess is still doing the alterations on Cece's dress. Schmidt gets into trouble with his colleagues when he plans his nuptials instead of doing his work. Nick struggles with the task of asking Reagan to be his `plus one' to the wedding. Winston and Aly try to keep things under wraps at the precinct.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Sam introduces Jess to his female best friend, Diane. Nick worries that Schmidt's father Gavin will let his son down and leave him disappointed again. Winston is offended by Sam's reaction to the birthday gift that he has bought for him. Masters of Sex star Caitlin FitzGerald guests.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta faces paying back all the money he has borrowed from his colleagues over the years, and goes to great lengths to keep a secret about Sergeant Jeffords. Santiago and Captain Holt team up to reopen the Brooklyn Broiler arson case.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Sophia's job gets in the way of her relationship with Peralta, he tries to win the favour of her boss Geoffrey (guest star Chris Parnell). Meanwhile, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch needs Captain Holt's help with a job recommendation.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Meanwhile, Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, but is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall tries to get baby Marvin to sleep while they are stuck in traffic during their long journey to Farhampton for the wedding, and devises three rhyming bedtime stories based around the gang's many exploits. American sitcom, guest starring James Van Der Beek.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney becomes convinced Robin is planning on throwing him a special wedding rehearsal dinner at the laser tag arena. Meanwhile, Ted tries to learn to play the piano to fulfil his promise of performing at the wedding ceremony dressed as Liberace, and Lily struggles with the fact she can't keep a secret. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess worries about whether to buy Paul a more expensive Christmas present after he surprises her with a lavish gift. The flatmates attend Schmidt's work party and, as the only male in the office, he has been forced to dress up as a sexy Santa yet again. Nick is determined not to miss his flight home for the holidays for the fifth year in a row - but a crisis among his friends places his plans in jeopardy. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Schmidt's plans for his 29th birthday party are ruined when he loses the reservation for a party bus, so Jess organises a last-minute bash with her socially awkward vice principal Tanya - and acquires the use of a yellow school bus. Nick's new girlfriend is determined to come along and meet his friends, unless he can stop her. Comedy, starring Max Greenfield and Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: When Caroline's grandmother wakes from a four-year coma with no knowledge of the financial scandal that engulfed her family, Caroline tries to hide the truth from her.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newhart) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna confides in Farrah about wanting Warren to open up more, and Lisa offers Maxine and Adam the outdoor space at the Loveboat to set up a beach bar. Meanwhile, Prince and Hunter are furious when Shane worms his way back into the McQueen's.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Youngstown Boys. An exploration of the class and power dynamics in college sports through the interconnected journeys of one-time dynamic running back Maurice Clarett and former elite head coach Jim Tressel. Clarett and Tressel emerged from opposite sides of the tracks in Youngstown, Ohio, and then joined up for a magical season at Ohio State University in 2002 that produced the first national football championship for the school in over 30 years. Shortly after, Clarett was suspended from college football and began a downward spiral that ended with a prison term. Tressel continued at Ohio State for another eight years before his career there also ended in scandal. Also available in HD(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.(n)

programme.title: Conquerors
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the lionfish, which eats other predators and has conquered such a large area of ocean that it has been described as the worst invasive species on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.sub-title: Tigers About the House - What Happened Next.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Clarks see the harsh reality of poaching in Indonesia when they visit tigers that were caught in snares, prompting Giles to concoct an ambitious plan to save the injured big cats in the wild. Back in Australia, Spot and Stripe are days away from their first birthday and will no longer be classed as cubs, while Spot faces an operation that may end with him losing all vision.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough's documentary charting the circle of life in the animal kingdom ends with creatures' attempts to rear their offspring, revealing the commitment involved and how for some parents it means risking their own lives. A turtle hauls itself up the beach to lay its eggs in a safe place, only for the tide to trap it behind a wall of coral. A mother bonobo in the Congo teaches its son the skills it will need to survive adulthood, bison protect their calves from the ever-present threat of wolves and a mother zebra has to lead its foal across a dangerous river.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Exploring the mountains of Dhofar in Oman, where the annual Indian Ocean monsoon has helped create a lost world of waterfalls and cloud forests filled with fascinating wildlife. The programme shows green sea turtles coming ashore in their thousands, shadowed by egg-stealing foxes, as well as footage of striped hyenas doing battle with Arabian wolves. Plus, a glimpse into the lives of chameleons, honey badgers and the elusive Arabian leopard.(n)

programme.title: Conquerors
programme.desc: Documentary examining the success of the thriving king crab, one of the largest shellfish, which is depopulating the seabed and changing the balance of species in the ocean.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor embarks on a journey encompassing Africa, Europe, America and China, meeting some of the world's most skilled fishermen and joining them on angling expeditions in a variety of waters. His first port of call is Costa Rica, where he tries to land the sailfish, said to be the fastest species of them all.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes the annual melting of more than three million square miles of Arctic sea ice, which can be perilous for indigenous species. He also assesses fears that the region could be ice-free throughout the summer months in 50 years' time, and speculates on the results for native polar bears, whales and guillemot chicks.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: The new moon arrives, and the forest is at its darkest, but that does not stop at Burnt Rock Tower's baby Ardhi attempting to walk.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: A storm is brewing, and as the families prepare for tough times, the White Rock tarsiers are torn between waiting for the return of Poppy and the need to hunt food.(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Brad Pitt star in David Fincher's Oscar-nominated drama, the former as a bored executive, the latter as a stranger he meets on a plane who introduces him to a world of ennui-alleviating physical pain: Fight Club, a semi-secret organisation where men vent their frustrations in bare knuckle fighting in dingy basements. But as Norton becomes more involved, he learns more about the shadowy organisation that plans to take on more than each other..(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: All-action adventure spiced with humour in which a retired Special Forces colonel returns to action when a ruthless South American dictator kidnaps his 11-year-old daughter. Armed to the teeth, he sets out to bring her back, leaving little else in one piece(n)

programme.title: PCU
programme.desc: Actor Hart Bochner turns director in the satirical Animal House update P.C.U.. Per the title, the film takes place on the campus of a University where, thanks to militant dean Jessica Walter, Political Correctness has reached ridiculous proportions. A group of dorm-room cutups, wallowing in their uncorrectness, declares war on the uptight student activists who call the shots. Saturday Night Live's David Spade is among the leading players; while he's funnier here than in his costarring stints in Chris Farley's films, he doesn't have much to work with. The subject matter covered in P.C.U. has already been tackled, with far funnier results, on Bill Maher's cable-TV weekly Politically Incorrect(n)

programme.title: A Very Brady Sequel
programme.desc: The '70s-trapped Bradys must travel to Hawaii to save the family after Carol's first husband shows up and threatens their idyllic existence. As Carol is torn between two husbands, Mike struggles to hold the family together and Alice cooks a lot of meat loaf. Shelley Long, Gary Cole, Tim Matheson, Christopher Daniel Barnes, Christine Taylor, Paul Sutera, Jennifer Elise Cox, Henriette Mantel(n)

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: Canadian comic John Candy headlines this comedy playing an air-traffic controller in dire need of rest. Complying to his doctor's orders, he rents a luxury cabin on a supposedly secluded Florida beach and heads south with his family. Unfortunately, they discover that the travel agent duped them and that the cabin is but a shack located on a very public beach. Comical chaos ensues as Candy and his family try to make the best of things(n)

programme.title: Dan in Real Life
programme.desc: Darkly comic drama about a journalist who dishes out advice to newspaper readers through a daily column in which he talks about his struggles with his life and his three children. However, when he falls in love with his brother's new girlfriend, he begins to lose his grip on his complicated life(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Brad Pitt star in David Fincher's Oscar-nominated drama, the former as a bored executive, the latter as a stranger he meets on a plane who introduces him to a world of ennui-alleviating physical pain: Fight Club, a semi-secret organisation where men vent their frustrations in bare knuckle fighting in dingy basements. But as Norton becomes more involved, he learns more about the shadowy organisation that plans to take on more than each other..(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots!
programme.desc: A "Top Gun" spoof in which a maverick Air Force pilot is coaxed back into service after giving up military life to live among a tribe of Native Americans. After reenlisting, he's tasked to destroy Iraqi nuclear facilities while dealing with a rival pilot and a manipulative aerospace executive(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
programme.desc: This Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker parody takes on the jingoistic action films typified by the Rambo series. Charlie Sheen returns in the role of maverick military man Topper Harley, assigned to take down Saddam Hussein(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Profile of military genius Gen. George S. Patton and chronicles his World War II campaigns on the European front and in North Africa, and his push into Germany(n)

programme.title: Sons of Liberty
programme.desc: A Dangerous Game. Part 1 of 3. Sam Adams is pursued by British authorities; riots break out in Boston(n)

programme.title: Sons of Liberty
programme.desc: Uprising, The. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Sons of Liberty
programme.desc: Independence. Conclusion. The Revolutionary War begins(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: This sequel to Speed sees Annie back and Jan de Bont directing but with Jason Patric as Alex Shaw taking over the Keanu Reeves role. The pair are an item and decide on a romantic cruise to the Caribbean. Unfortunately, also aboard the cruise liner are a gathering of diamond merchants, complete with their wares and arch-villain John Geiger, who plans to steal their merchandise. Unlike the original Speed , where the trick was that the bus would explode if it slowed down, this time, speed is of the essence - the plan is to ram the ship into dry land and, in the mayhem, escape with the loot. Bullock and Patric are perfect as the dynamic duo who save the day and the ocean-going scenario allows for more spectacular special effects than the original. Edited for language and violence(n)
