programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Part 1. Part 1 of 3. A McCoy is murdered by a Hatfield and a forbidden love affair begins at the start of the legendary Hatfield-McCoy family feud, which nearly brought the American states of Kentucky and West Virginia to civil war in the 1880s(n)

programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 3. The Hatfields seek revenge after one of theirs is murdered by a McCoy. When friends and neighbours join the fighting, West Virginia and Kentucky are brought to the brink of civil war(n)

programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Part 3. Conclusion. The Hatfields are forced deeper into the mountains; Johnse Hatfield eyes another McCoy woman; and the fighting between the two families peaks in a New Year's Day battle(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: John Sturges' classic take on Kurosawa's Seven Samurai stars Yul Brynner as Chris Adams, a gun for hire who's down on his luck. Approached by the elders of a small Mexican village terrorised by the bandit Calvera, he agrees to recruit another six gunslingers in return for food and lodging. And so the group, including the scene-stealing Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn and James Coburn, agree to take on the bandidos. The film spawned three sequels but the original is still the best, with outstanding camerawork, including a tracking shot of Calvera's escape from the village that is fluidity perfected, and a stirring iconic score by Elmer Bernstein(n)

programme.title: Cyborg
programme.desc: Jean-Claude Van Damme stars in this action adventure movie set in a desolate future where all human life is threatened by a virulent plague. But Pearl Prophet, a half-human, half-robot heroine may hold the key to combating the plague if she can only make it safely back to Atlanta. Van Damme plays Gibson Rickenbacker, the man charged with escorting Pearl safely to her destination for the good of mankind(n)

programme.title: Operation: Endgame
programme.desc: In this edgy action-comedy, a new recruit (Joe Anderson) joins an elite gang of assassins charged with protecting the U.S., and he must fight to stay alive when his first day on the job finds him responsible for eliminating a traitor within their ranks(n)

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla II
programme.desc: The big mean green guy battles his robotic doppelganger in this high-tech update of the classic 1974 monster mash(n)

programme.title: Warren Miller's Flow State
programme.desc: Skiers test the powder in Alaska, Utah, Switzerland, Japan, Norway and more(n)

programme.title: Beer for My Horses
programme.desc: Country music star Toby Keith writes and stars in this road movie comedy as a deputy who takes to the road with a fellow cop (played by co-writer Rodney Carrington) in order to save their kidnapped girlfriends. The CMT Films production is directed by Michael Salomon (A Glimpse of Hell), with Ted Nugent, Willie Nelson, Claire Forlani, Barry Corbin, and Tom Skerritt filling out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Empire State
programme.desc: A security guard and his best friend scheme to rob an armored-car company, but a determined cop is hot on their tail(n)

programme.title: Kill the Irishman
programme.desc: This biopic follows Cleveland union rep Danny Greene, who earned notoriety in the mid-'70s for his willingness to defy the Italian mob. A former Mafia enforcer, Greene managed to survive numerous assassination attempts, and eventually he dealt a devastating blow to organized-crime syndicates across the U.S(n)

programme.title: William Shakespeare's 'Romeo & Juliet'
programme.desc: The Bard gets a '90s makeover in this imaginative rendition of the ill-fated romance between the star-crossed lovers(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Three teens are lured to a small town, where they are kidnapped by a maniacal fundamentalist preacher (Michael Parks) in this terrifying shocker. Eventually, their disappearance triggers a shoot-out between the preacher's followers and the ATF(n)

programme.title: Bait
programme.desc: Supermarket shoppers battle man-eating sharks when a tsunami plunges a coastal resort under water, and the perfect predator gets a whole new stalking ground. Queensland, Australia: The weather is perfect, the water is blue, and the vacationers at a luxury resort file into an underground supermarket to stock up for another day in paradise. Just then, an armed madman bursts in with an itchy trigger finger and a desperate gleam in his eye. Little do the frightened hostages realize, he will soon be the least of their worries; the waters around Queensland are rising fast, and before long the store will be completely submerged. When that happens, the aisles will be filled with hungry tiger sharks in search of a fresh meal. Now, in order to avoid becoming the Catch of the Day, the desperate shoppers must band together, and show the sharks who's really at the top of the food chain(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Three teens are lured to a small town, where they are kidnapped by a maniacal fundamentalist preacher (Michael Parks) in this terrifying shocker. Eventually, their disappearance triggers a shoot-out between the preacher's followers and the ATF(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: A pair of feuding Navy SEALs must work together to stop a terrorist who has stolen a supply of American missiles(n)

programme.title: Dolph Lundgren Is the Killing Machine
programme.desc: Family man Edward Genn is desperate to escape his secret past as an assassin, but when his cover is blown, old enemies re-emerge(n)

programme.title: Day Watch
programme.desc: Timur Bekmambetov's sequel to the Russian fantasy blockbuster Night Watch begins with Anton discovering his son Yegor has gone over to the dark side and is now one of the Great Others, who threatens the truce. When Yegor's tutor Olga is found killed, Anton is accused of murder by the Day Watch, but a mind-swap between him and the murdered woman offers him a chance of salvation if he can find an ancient warrior's tomb and the legendary Chalk of Fate, which can rewrite history. From the opening stupendous battle sequence, Bekmambetov's cinematic visions complement the fantasy of the film, providing a feast for the eye as well as the mind(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: One More Time. The government drafts the Team to rescue a general and his daughter from guerrillas in Borneo. Lynch: William Lucking. Rashaad: Nico Minardos. Kathy: Amy Steel(n)

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: An expedition to the summit of K2 results in disaster in this intense mountaineering adventure. When a sudden storm traps a billionaire, climber Annie Garrett and a guide in an icy crevasse, it's up to Annie's brother (Chris O'Donnell) to rescue them. But he soon discovers that one member of his rescue team may have his own agenda. Bill Paxton, Robin Tunney, Scott Glenn(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove Church
programme.desc: A pastor must rescue his estranged son, who is wanted for murder and on the run from a posse. They eventually end up in a small town in Texas, where they found a famous church(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: For 60 years, a Tibetan monk has protected an ancient scroll which gives its owner immortality and incredible power. With a new generation of Nazis determined to snatch the scroll, the monk recruits a young pickpocket to help defeat evil(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: Comedy sci-fi adventure in which the stars of a 1970s sci-fi show, now scraping a living through re-runs and sci-fi conventions, are beamed aboard an alien spacecraft. Believing the cast's heroic on-screen dramas are historical documents of real-life adventures, the band of aliens turn to the ailing celebrities for help in their quest to overcome the oppressive regime in their solar system(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Girl Who Cried Wolf.
programme.desc: Sharona sees a blood-covered man in her garage and thinks she is losing her sanity - until she realises the plot of a story she wrote is coming to life. Desperate to get rid of his replacement nurse, Monk helps tie together the clues that will solve the mystery. Guest starring Emma Caulfield (Buffy) and Niecy Nash (Reno 911!).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part series finale, Hightower wants to hand herself in, knowing she will be found innocent of Todd Johnson's murder, but Jane dissuades her, not wanting to risk scaring Red John underground. The consultant manages to inform all four suspects of her location and awaits the arrival of the accomplice, who he will use to track down the serial killer - only for Lisbon to get injured in the ploy. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is taken into custody for fatally shooting the man he believed to be serial killer Red John, but bluffs his way out of jail and tries to exonerate himself. He begins by visiting his victim's widow - and learns her house contains not only a secret room, but also a reluctant guest. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In a bid to get his old team-mates back together, Patrick decides to pit them against his new work colleagues in a challenge to solve the murder of a fitness trainer. Meanwhile, Lisbon visits Red John's wife Sally at her home, only to discover she has committed suicide. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: One of Patrick's former clients gets in touch with him when her nine-year-old son is kidnapped and demands that he use his psychic powers to help find the child, despite Lisbon's scepticism. The investigation leads to relatives of the boy, but things get complicated when the main suspect is killed.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. She accepts the help of a retired marine colonel when he comes forward with information about the murders - but begins to believe he knows more than he is letting on. Drama, with Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. Meanwhile, Brenda's squad learns she was charged with sexual misconduct in her previous job in Atlanta. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates when the daughter of a congresswoman is raped and murdered in her home, and is drawn into a seedy underworld. The evidence prompts her to examine the victim's sexual predilections - and uncovers a secret that could make her the next victim. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda is called on to investigate when a judge is carjacked and murdered. Despite having a long list of witnesses, the one person she's certain can help is the victim's autistic son.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when naval cryptanalyst Andrew Wells is shot dead in a park outside Baltimore. At the scene, Tony spots a man who was one of his informants from 15 years earlier when he was a police officer, but who went into hiding after a bid to bring down the Russian mobsters he worked for went wrong. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team works with Abigail Borin of the Coast Guard Investigative Service after a highly suspicious explosion and fire on board an oil rig kills a US marine corps reservist. Abby detects malware in the platform's computer systems, while Ducky finds traces on the victim's body that lead to a lawyer who works for the oil company. Back in the office, a prankster is bringing some light relief and although the likeliest suspect is Tony, he denies any involvement. Crime drama, guest starring Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigate the death of a marine sergeant who appears to have been caught in the crossfire during a bungled robbery, but Tony and Tim find evidence the victim may have been targeted. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Extended episode in which Brian and Stewie travel to the North Pole to teach Father Christmas a lesson after being snubbed by a mall-based Santa. However, on finding him incapacitated, the pair decide to step into his sleigh and deliver the gifts in his place - but their efforts fall desperately short of the mark.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan decides to alleviate the stresses of his hectic family life by buying a hot tub. However, he fails to count on his new purchase having an evil agenda of its own. Animated comedy, with the voice of show creator Seth MacFarlane, and guest star Cee-Lo Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Crossover episode in which characters from Family Guy and The Cleveland Show end up meeting the Smiths when a storm hits the towns of Quahog, Stoolbend and Langley Falls.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: He's Too Sexy for His Fat.
programme.desc: Chris grows increasingly uncomfortable with his weight and visits a cosmetic surgeon to arrange liposuction. However, it is Peter who ends up having the procedure - and his new appearance causes him to become vain and self-obsessed.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns his house on Spooner Street is not officially a part of the United States, and decides to take drastic action - by establishing his own country and declaring war on America.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smith family stars in a spoof of classic James Bond films. Stan sets out to stop producer Tearjerker (played by Roger), who has devised a diabolical scheme to make movies so depressing that anyone who watches them will ultimately die of despair.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine feels threatened when her mother-in-law seeks Stan's support after breaking up with her latest boyfriend, so she enlists Roger to solve her meddling relative's romantic woes.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian goes to collect Stewie from Lois's parents' house in Palm Springs - but the duo lose their plane tickets in an airport bar, and find themselves with no choice but to stow away on board a train back to Quahog. Meanwhile, the Griffins try to spice up their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A new drug craze hits town, prompting Peter to assume the guise of new student Lando Griffin to eradicate the problem at Meg's school, where he extols the virtues of clean living with a song-and-dance routine inspired by Grease. Animated adventure, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan's friends are shocked to learn that he has never killed anyone, despite his high-octane career. Roger and the guys rally round to help him get off the mark.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine becomes a surrogate mother for gay neighbours Terry and Greg, prompting an outraged Stan to kidnap the baby once she is born. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger think Klaus is out to get them.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A girl at a day-care centre steals Stewie's heart, and Peter persuades Lois to become a flight attendant so he can enjoy the benefits of free air travel around the world. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter gets on the wrong side of socially inept gangster Big Fat Paulie, putting Lois in the sights of a hitman. The Griffins visit the Mob boss on the day of his daughter's wedding in the hope that he will call off the killing. Animated comedy, with the guest voice of Michael Chiklis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan returns home from another dangerous mission to find Francine and the family have decorated the house for Christmas. Deciding their efforts do not live up to his high standards, he sets out to find the perfect tree, but meets an untimely end during his search, and battles the forces of evil to save his loved ones and earn another chance at life.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine pretends to kidnap Roger after he has a fight with Stan, hoping to demonstrate how much he means to the family. However, when her agent husband refuses to pay the ransom, the alien is forced to rethink the way he treats people.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team are assigned to protect the mayor during a rally about immigration rights. While searching the area, they find the body of a photographer who has been robbed and murdered. The investigation initially seems to point to a homeless man, but when the memory card in the victim's camera is found to have a close-up picture of the killer on it, the team races to prevent an imminent murder.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a girl on an island and discovers the victim had been conducting inquiries into her father's murder. Jane gathers the town residents for a meeting and tells them he knows the killer is among them, but his suspicions are badly received by the locals. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The murder of a gay man stirs political tension in the city, and Chief Pope tasks Brenda with bringing the killer to justice. However, she also has to contend with internal conflicts in the department, as Taylor undermines her authority and a team member actively works against her.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The daughter of a wealthy family's housekeeper is raped and murdered, and the authorities are quick to point the finger of blame at a known sex offender. However, Brenda is convinced there is more to the case than meets the eye, and struggles to overcome her own beliefs and concoct a logical explanation. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes Steve's legal guardian, but his overzealous approach to parenting gets his adopted son's school principal fired. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine decide to make their own fun at the world's biggest water park.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan persuades his last single friend to get married so he can realise his dream of becoming a best man, but when he invites an ex-convict to the wedding, she jeopardises the event. Elsewhere, Ricky Martin causes Roger to doubt himself.(n)

programme.title: Shots Fired
programme.desc: Cory reveals crucial information about the night Joey was killed, allowing Preston and Ashe to refine their list of suspects. Crime drama, starring Sanaa Lathan and Stephan James.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to help Meg in her bid to become a reporter for the school newspaper by writing an article falsely claiming actor Luke Perry, who guest stars as himself, is gay. programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and his friends go on an extended drinking binge in a bid to win a tour of the local brewery - but their bad behaviour lands them in trouble with owner Pawtucket Pat, who bears more than a passing resemblance to Willy Wonka. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa the Simpson. Lisa Simpson (voice of Yeardley Smith) has long been accustomed to being the smartest kid in her class, so when she's unable to figure out a puzzle being passed around by her classmates, she can't help but feel something's wrong. After a few other lapses in her memory, Lisa wonders out loud about what's happening, and Grandpa Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) warns her about the long-term effects of the "Simpson Gene." According to Grandpa, most Simpsons start out smart but the time they're done with grade school, they become progressively dumber with each passing year, and after watching her father Homer (also voiced by Castellaneta) and brother Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) in action, she begins to fear Grandpa is right and that her days as an intellectual may be numbered. Meanwhile, elderly Jasper (voice of Harry Shearer) has decided to freeze himself in order to survive into the coming centuries, but since he can't afford cryonic suspension, he simply parks himself in the ice cream case at the Kwik-E-Mart until he becomes a block of ice. Ever-entrepreneurial Apu (voice of Hank Azaria) knows a golden opportunity when he sees one, and is soon charging patrons to look at the frozen wonder. "Lisa The Simpson" was first aired on March 8, 1998(n)

programme.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
programme.desc: A burnt-out British spy is ordered to venture undercover in East Germany. He begins by faking his resignation and subsequent alcoholic depression to dupe the enemy into trusting him, but, as he becomes further embroiled in his mission, he comes to realise that he is merely a pawn. Espionage thriller, based on John Le Carre's novel, starring Richard Burton, Claire Bloom, Oskar Werner and Peter Van Eyck.(n)

programme.title: The War Wagon
programme.desc: A convict is released from prison and swears vengeance on the corrupt mining contractor who took his gold-rich land. On the way, he encounters an old enemy who reveals that the gold from the mine is about to be transported in an armoured stagecoach - and suggests they join forces to steal it. Western, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Cabot and Howard Keel.(n)

programme.title: The Great St Trinian's Train Robbery
programme.desc: A crook and his cronies stash the money from a train heist in a deserted old mansion, planning to recover it in good time. However, several years later, when the thieves arrive to collect their loot, they discover the building has been turned into a school for girls where the pupils have become infamous for their escapades. Comedy, starring Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, Reg Varney and George Cole.(n)

programme.title: The Phantom
programme.desc: A jungle-dwelling masked adventurer leaves his African home for New York in a bid to stop the power-crazed schemes of an evil industrialist. The tycoon is on the hunt for three legendary magical skulls, which can be combined to form the ultimate weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Billy Zane, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Treat Williams and Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.title: Monsters: Dark Continent
programme.desc: Premiere. The Infected Zones have now spread worldwide and giant alien creatures have infested the Middle East. A US military force is deployed to destroy the monsters, as well as dealing with local insurgents. Sci-fi sequel set 10 years after the original film, starring Johnny Harris, Sam Keeley and Joe Dempsie.(n)

programme.title: The Impossible
programme.desc: A British family spends Christmas in Thailand, only to get caught up in the 2004 tsunami. While his mother lies injured in hospital, the eldest son ventures into the ensuing chaos to search for his father and younger brothers, whom he was separated from during the crisis. Drama, with Naomi Watts, Ewan McGregor and Tom Holland.(n)

programme.title: Family Business
programme.desc: Reformed crook Vito has turned away from a life of crime - much to the dismay of his criminal father, Jessie. However, when his son Adam comes up with a supposedly foolproof plan for a robbery, Jessie is quick to get involved - forcing Vito to grudgingly abandon the straight and narrow to keep an eye on his family. Crime comedy, with Sean Connery, Dustin Hoffman, Matthew Broderick and Rosana DeSoto.(n)

programme.title: Rear Window
programme.desc: A photographer is left housebound and in a wheelchair after breaking his leg in an accident. He passes the time watching the comings and goings of his neighbours in the apartment block opposite and becomes convinced one of them has committed a murder. However, he has trouble persuading anyone to believe his story. Hitchcock thriller, starring James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Raymond Burr, Thelma Ritter and Judith Evelyn.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon

programme.title: Mary, Queen of Scots
programme.desc: Historical biopic about the life and loves of the ill-fated 16th-century monarch, whose opposition to her cousin Elizabeth I led to her downfall and execution. Starring Vanessa Redgrave, Glenda Jackson, Timothy Dalton, Patrick McGoohan, Nigel Davenport and Ian Holm.(n)

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Ford's Western, with John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish.(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Words
programme.desc: A spiritual guru decides to teach his lying literary agent a lesson for his dishonesty, and places a curse on him. The spell means he can only speak another 1,000 words in his life - and when the words run out, he will die. The only way to break the enchantment is to put right all his past mistakes. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1
programme.desc: Katniss Everdeen is brought to a secretive underground society following the destruction of the televised deathmatch. She becomes the figurehead of a revolution against the despotic Panem regime, while her friend Peeta remains a captive of its tyrannical president. Part one of the two-part conclusion to the sci-fi adventure series, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Experimenter

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe embark on the second day of their culinary road trip. They reach Trawden in Lancashire and pull up beside the ruins of Wycoller Hall with one of their prize cheesecakes to compete in a garden show against some of the best local bakers. Along the way, they catch up with butcher Joseph Mellin to sample a delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Kirkby Lonsdale, Cumbria, where they enter the `dessert in a wine glass' category at the Lunesdale Country Show. They also meet gamekeeper Richard Wolfenden, who attends to the red grouse on Fourstones Moor, and he provides them with the luxury ingredient of freshly caught game.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Former Saved By the Bell star Tiffani Thiessen prepares snacks perfect for game night with her friends Ross Mathews, Jillian Barberie and Tim Meadows.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: White Collar co-star Tim DeKay and his family join Tiffani, her husband Brady and their daughter Harper, for a family style feast. Tiffani prepares a kid-friendly menu that even the adults love. Watermelon Salad with Fresh Mint and Feta Cheese, a Pickle and Potato Salad, and tender and crispy Fried Chicken are served before clearing the table for dessert- Root Beer Floats with Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The culinary competition returns, with chefs battling it out for the opportunity to cook at a banquet at St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day. The first edition features entrants from Northern Ireland, with returning finalist Raymond McArdle taking on Chris McGowan and Will Brown as they prepare the ideal starter for the feast. The hopefuls must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Celia Sandys in the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Raymond McArdle, Chris McGowan and Will Brown prepare seafood courses, taking inspiration from their families' and communities' contributions to the war effort. The contenders are vying to win a place in the regional final to get the chance to cook at a banquet marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond embarks on a big food-shopping trip, buying chicken thighs to prepare peach and whiskey chicken.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ladd is busy coaching at a football training camp, so Ree makes lunch for 120 hungry staff and children, whipping up a picnic of hot roast beef sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: New series. Contestants compete to have their cake at an event for executive producers of The Simpsons, and walk out with the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: The competition heats up with two rounds of head-to-head barbecue battles, and chef Kardea Brown joins the judging panel to help decide which young barbecue cook will be sent home.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels across America on a mission to highlight some of the nation's culinary treasures. He begins in Austin, Texas, where he uncovers sought-after and top-secret restaurants and dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boston, where he sheds light on some lesser-known dishes and secret restaurants in a town well known for its food.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is in Southern California for two unbelievable backyard blowouts.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Nothing grabs Roger's attention like a raging wood-burning fire, as he witnesses a spectacular feast that everyone can dive into.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps a pizzeria owner put an end to the family drama that is tearing his business apart and driving away customers.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A Californian restaurant owner becomes suspicious when there is a spike in coupon use, and asks the team to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps the owner of Red Balls Rock-and Roll Pizza, Moorpark, California when his restaurant has a set of inventory discrepancies.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: There's a long line of tradition on the menu when Andrew Zimmern visits Baltimore and the Chesapeake Bay.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving 33-year-old business Ducky's Family Restaurant in Kokomo, Indiana from failure in just two days and with a budget of only $10,000.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Pina Pizza House in Downey, California believes his college-enrolled waiter may not have his best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Parma, Las Vegas contacts the team for help after he noticed disparities in sales receipts and the inventory for his high-end Italian deli meats.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten joins local chef Joe Realmuto to feed 50 hungry volunteers for the East Hampton Ambulance service.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten lifts the lid on all things French, including tips on table settings and how to get the traditional flavours fast.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten prepares a series of recipes with fruit as the main ingredient.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: A mozzarella masterclass with a local cheese maker, and an Italian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares a vegetarian meal beginning with vegetable salad rolls before making a roasted garlic and vegetable tart.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares an elegant dinner menu for a friend's birthday, including slow roasted ribs with a rich mushroom jus.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Ezra and Julie throw out a life preserver to the Drag'n Angels. Can these delightful dragon boat racers win in the water and in the kitchen?.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It is a busy day on the ranch with the whole Drummond gang moving cattle, so Ree prepares lunch, making a meaty pepperoni pizza with homemade pizza sauce.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes meals that can be prepared in advance, including beef sandwiches and a meat sauce - the secret to so many fabulous feasts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond turns her attention to desserts, including marshmallow pops for a sleepover treat and lime and coconut butter cookies for her step-mother.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond treats her family to a frontier-style Tex-Mex feast, featuring chicken and beef fajitas, after they spend the day working cattle.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: New series. Contestants compete to have their cake at an event for executive producers of The Simpsons, and walk out with the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Nothing says Texas like barbecue and that's exactly what Tiffani brings to the table for her White Collar co-stars Sharif Atkins, Tim DeKay and Willie Garson. Tequila Peach Tea, Pimento Cheese Spread and fall-from-the-bone BBQ Ribs that have been rubbed and sauced go with Southern Greens done with bacon and a spicy vinaigrette. To finish off the meal, Tiffani brings in one of her favorite pecan pies to top with her Homemade Vanilla Bean Whipped Cream.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Love is in the air as Jason and Naomi Priestley join Tiffani and her husband, Brady, for a menu torn from the pages of their own fairy tales! Arugula Salad with White Truffle Oil, Marcona Almonds and Shaved Parmesan, plus juicy Cast Iron Steak Filets with Roasted Shallots are served with Roasted Potatoes. For a twist on dessert, Tiffani says 'I do' to an elaborate cheese plate with all the pairings.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning finalist Raymond McArdle goes all out to impress the mystery judge by cooking two separate dishes as he and fellow Northern Ireland chefs Chris McGowan and Will Brown prepare main courses. The contenders are vying for a place in the regional final and the chance to cook at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Raymond McArdle, Chris McGowan and Will Brown have one last chance to impress in their attempt to win a chance to cook at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day. The mystery Great British Menu veteran assesses their desserts and decides which one of the trio will not be returning for the regional final.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares food for Potluck Sunday at church, while her family is busy on the ranch.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It is a tale of two dinners at the Drummond Ranch - one for the kids and one for the grown-ups. The kids are having baked ziti, while Ree makes rib eye steaks with cowboy butter.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Contestants create cakes based around the DC Comics franchise, featuring characters such as Batman, Aquaman and Spiderman.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: The barbecue arena is transformed into a Polynesian paradise for the third week of competition as the contestants are challenged to make a luau pork dish with a tropical fruit side.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman begins his Wisconsin journey by hunting for the best cheese. The crew visits the Wisconsin Cheese Mart, a local market/restaurant hybrid.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Chicaco to explore the best restaurants. His first stop is Scofflaw, a prohibition era-inspired hide-out known for its unique menu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits South Carolina for two spectacular low country cookouts, a traditional backyard 'pig pickin', and a classic oyster roast.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger attends the 100-year anniversary of the St Mary Magdalene Church Picnic in Owensboro, where thousand pounds of meat will cook over 100 feet of fire and smoke.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's checks out an Italian place cooking veal in Key Largo, Florida, and a local legend serving up Puerto Rican favourites in San Francisco.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy crosses the country to eat an eclectic mix of dishes from a Mexican restaurant, a local landmark and a New Orleans-inspired spot.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie helps Mohammad, owner of Shiraz Persian Restaurant, who has been forced out of business twice before.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Encore Dinner Theatre, Tustin, asks for help when he wonders whether a waiter's relationship is affecting customer service.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours that customers are being served off-menu food, Esdras and Javi, owners of Mexicali Tacos in Los Angeles, call Charles to investigate.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Raymond prepares to celebrate the Queen's birthday, completely oblivious to the fact that girlfriend Patricia is expecting something special for their 10th anniversary.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: Every Clown Wants to Play Hamlet.
programme.desc: The local amateur dramatic society's production of Hamlet and a mysterious disappearance leads Timothy to suspect his mother has been romantically involved with his uncle.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel's peaceful weekend in the country is disrupted when they find the faithful Mrs Bale is not her usual cheerful self. To add to their woes, Lionel feels unwell - but a visit from a doctor with a strange bedside manner sheds light on their housekeeper's mood.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Husband and the Showgirls.
programme.desc: Tom and Smiler arrange an interesting blind date and Truly discovers his ex-wife's new husband is coming to town. Frank Thornton and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By

programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Penny-pinching Basil goes behind Sybil's back to save money on structural alterations to the hotel and hires an incompetent cowboy builder to do the job - an underhand tactic that ends up costing him dearly. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns are excited as preparations for Rory and Dino's big day are in full swing - although Agnes's mood is dampened when she meets flamboyant celebrity wedding planner La La Doggy. The foul-mouthed matriarch also clashes with Father Damien when he raises religious concerns about the ceremony - and to top it all off, she gets more than she bargained for when she invites Cathy's boyfriend's parents over for the evening. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll, with Jennifer Gibney, Rory Cowan and Conor Moloney.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to her own brand of humour, before introducing routines by camp comic Joe Lycett and award-winning funnyman Russell Kane.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy's American girlfriend puts his taboo-bashing beliefs to the test and Mark finds himself getting on well with Sophie, especially once he starts hacking into her e-mails. Starring David Mitchell, Robert Webb and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dafydd has a big decision to make - stay at home as the only gay in the village, or travel to London and risk becoming one of the crowd. Florence agonises over whether to hang up her crinolines, Linda receives hassle from the students, and Mrs Emery has knee trouble - causing a stomach-churning consultation for the doctor. Imelda Staunton guest stars in a Christmas special from 2005.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Classroom comedy about a group of teachers who really should know better. David Walliams stars as uptight deputy head of chemistry Mr Church, who is about to resign from Greybridge School when he meets the attractive new French tutor Miss Postern. However, his chances of wooing her are threatened when laddish PE instructor Mr Gunn also makes a move on their colleague - so he takes advice from a pupil on how to succeed with women. Catherine Tate, Philip Glenister and Frances de la Tour co-star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to her own brand of humour, before introducing routines by camp comic Joe Lycett and award-winning funnyman Russell Kane.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: The first episode of the comedy sketch show, with Matt Lucas and David Walliams. Kenny Craig mesmerises his date in a Chinese restaurant, while Dennis Waterman brushes up his Shakespeare. Meanwhile, Lou and Andy go to the theatre, and Sebastian becomes jealous of the prime minister's treasury aide. Anthony Head guest stars.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Comedy duo Dawn and Jennifer introduce a parody of Misery.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Lou takes Andy to a posh restaurant, but he insists on dressing as a Smurf. Dafydd goes in search of the only copy of the Gay Times in the village, Katie receives a special visitor, and the Prime Minister and Sebastian ponder the results of an opinion poll. David Soul guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Constable Goody turns green with envy when Constable Habib falls in love with a fireman, while DI Grim gets to grips with terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy receives his great uncle's ashes, which are accompanied by some cryptic advice about affairs of the heart. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean return from a weekend away to find Judith's boyfriend has been staying at the house. To add to their woes, Alistair announces he has got engaged to a girl named Mercury - dashing their hopes of his ever becoming their son-in-law. Comedy starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A persistent door-to-door salesman makes grouchy Victor Meldrew see red - and an unending stream of junk mail through his letterbox threatens to push him over the brink into insanity. Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Chaos abounds at an annual parade held to celebrate a famous battle. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up and Nora Batty prepares to sit on a float playing the part of his wife. Norman Wisdom makes a cameo appearance.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A nagging toothache forces a reluctant Del to visit the dentist, but he gets more than he bargained for when the receptionist falls for him and embarks on a Fatal Attraction-style campaign to get her hooks into him. Meanwhile, Cassandra's plan to have a baby takes its toll on Rodney, who has never been so exhausted in all his life. Christmas special from 1993.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly grocer Arkwright advertises for a live-in housekeeper, and pits his retail expertise against a red-hot vacuum-cleaner salesman. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

Meanwhile, Cassandra's plan to have a baby takes its toll on Rodney, who has never been so exhausted in all his life. Christmas special from 1993.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and presenter Jason Manford hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by Geordie favourite Chris Ramsey and the multi-talented Doc Brown.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark grows concerned that Jeff and Sophie's work trip to Aberdeen could turn into something intimate, and attempts to stop them hooking up together. Meanwhile, Jeremy gets a new girlfriend - but is seized by fits of jealousy whenever she looks at another man. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The students plan a spectacular protest to prevent council officials demolishing their house. First-ever episode of the anarchic comedy. Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan star, with Alexei Sayle and mod band Nine Below Zero.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each create a savoury sabayon sauce and use it to make a glaze for seafood. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare French pork pie stuffed with chestnuts and apple and served with a British salad cream, before the contenders prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their pie-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up their signature dish for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, they are faced with cooking six individual pork pies - a task that proves problematic for vegetarian Jason - and preparing a meringue. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's Indian spiced potato galette on chickpeas, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. Can they identify all 12 herbs and spices in the recipe? They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Tracey MacLeod, who tells them exactly what she thinks of their culinary efforts, before they find out who has made it through to the semi-finals and who will be hanging up their aprons.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin offers a guide to desserts, returning to places from his culinary past to reveal the source of his best recipes. The quest begins with a `best of British' theme at Castle Howard, North Yorkshire, where he is inspired to reinvent quintessential puddings including spotted dick, junket, Sussex pond and lardy cake, with help from his assistant chef Will Torrent.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare a selection of extravagant British gourmet dishes, using high-quality ingredients including lobster, truffles, prime cuts of meat and expensive chocolate. The duo also explore the stories behind the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey concludes in Israel, the country he grew up in. He explores fresh produce in Tel Aviv, samples seafood with a twist and explores the popularity of hummus. Later, he prepares shakshuka, a Mediterranean dish where eggs are poached in a spicy sauce of tomatoes, onion and hot chilli peppers. Plus, he travels to a remote farm to obtain one of his favourite ingredients - pomegranate.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: The MasterChef judge reconnects with his homeland's culinary heritage by cooking up a selection of Aussie delights. In the first of a two-part episode filmed in Sydney, he enjoys scallop kebabs at a family barbecue.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining four chefs from an earlier heat who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to shape rolls, baguettes and four-plait loaves from bread dough. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's fish soup made with champagne, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their dessert-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up cheesecake and chocolate roulade for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, this quarter-final showstopper sees the cooks creating a croquembouche - a choux pastry tower made of hundreds of profiteroles. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the fourth heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their calling card, a single plate of food that represents who they are, followed by the invention test, in which they prepare a dish in one hour from a choice of two sets of surprise ingredients. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing dinner for 2009 MasterChef winner Mat Follas and Tom Rennolds and Daksha Mistry, finalists from 2012 and 2006 respectively. It's then down to the judges to decide which two will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Mediterranean cuisine and ingredients have influenced British culinary culture since it was first introduced by the Romans, and prepare their favourite recipes.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi continues his culinary journey as he visits four of the Mediterranean's most beautiful islands, including Sardinia, Majorca and Crete. He begins on the French island of Corsica, where he discovers how its lush green landscape flavours the food, from cheese to honey, and meets its most celebrated chefs. He also prepares recipes including roasted fish with aromatic Corsican olive oil, Swiss chard and herb tart with local cheeses, honey and apricot trifle with walnuts and lavender, chestnut cake and a rich veal stew.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MasterChef judge immerses himself in the food culture of Sydney's Lebanese community, before he enjoys a spot of fine dining.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: David Spade stars in this frisky comedy an inept restaurateur who dognaps a pooch belonging to his new neighbor, a beautiful French cellist (Sophie Marceau) so he'll have an excuse to talk to her. He decides to keep the pup for awhile, then return him and be the hero. Patrick Bruel, Artie Lange, Mitchell Whitfield(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-02-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele
programme.desc: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele. Advice columnist Dan Savage; counter-terrorism expert Richard A. Clarke. The roundtable guests are legal analyst Dan Abrams, news anchor Katty Kay and political analyst Michael Steele(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A parody of the much-done medieval English tale of Robin Hood and his Merry Men. English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John and his henchman, the Sheriff of Rottingham(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: When a young man named Ethan falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, he discovers she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this captivating sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-02-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-02-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: The comic and star of film and television fires on all cylinders in this stand-up performance at Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C. Playfully profane innuendo and graphic gestures abound as Lawrence riffs on sex, love, race, drugs and family life, and even reflects on his legal and health troubles(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A rich Wall Street player basks in his late-1980s yuppie lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Drama based on the life and career of the young Mexican-American singer who was murdered just as she was on the verge of crossing over from the Tejano pop scene to the mainstream. From her early start to success at 17, Selena's progress is traced - right up to when she was shot by the woman who ran her fan club(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: (2001) Action tale adapted from the popular video game in which the eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. Leaving behind her life of luxury, the highly-trained adventurer travels to exotic and dangerous locales, where she battles a variety of fantastical creatures in the knowledge that the fate of mankind rests in her hands(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: A restaging of the surprise Japanese attack against the backdrop of a love triangle involving a nurse and two fighter pilots(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: This biopic of airline pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger depicts his successful emergency landing of an Airbus A320 on the Hudson River in January 2009. In the aftermath of this unprecedented feat, he must endure the weight of sudden fame, second-guessing by investigators and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day(n)

programme.desc: Jason Bourne emerges from seclusion to reenter the world of high-stakes espionage(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Wars to Come. In the Series 5 premiere, Varys struggles to convince Tyrion to think outside the box while discussing a potential occupant of the Iron Throne. Meanwhile, Stannis leans on Jon to secure loyalty from a rival; Daenerys ignores tradition to remain on her progressive path; and Cersei and Jaime try to move on from Tywin's demise(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The House of Black and White
programme.desc: The House of Black and White. Arya arrives in Braavos; Brienne and Podrick find danger while travelling; Cersei worries about Myrcella in Dorne when Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death; Jon is tempted by Stannis(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: High Sparrow. Cersei meets the High Sparrow after learning of a clergyman's embarrassing tale. Meanwhile, Davos talks to Jon about the future of Winterfell, where Ramsay Snow has just learned the identity of his future bride; Arya grows impatient doing menial tasks in the House of Black and White; and Tyrion searches for more comfortable surroundings on a long trip with Varys(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Sons of the Harpy. Jaime and Bronn sneak into Dorne by sea, but their arrival isn't the secret they'd hoped it would be. Meanwhile, Sansa discusses her future with Littlefinger; Jon is tempted by Melisandre; and Tyrion has a new travelling companion on his way to Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Kill the Boy. Jon finds an unexpected ally outside the Night's Watch, but his own men strongly disapprove of his next move. Meanwhile, Brienne tries to let Sansa know she's not alone; Daenerys faces a tough decision after losing a trusted adviser; Ramsay maintains his control over Theon; and Jorah and Tyrion have a terrifying encounter on the water(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken. The Sand Snakes attack when their prey practically lands in their laps. Meanwhile, Arya continues her training in Braavos; Trystane and Myrcella discuss their future; Jorah and Tyrion have a run-in with slavers; and Littlefinger meets with Cersei to declare his loyalty to the throne(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Gift. Sansa reaches out to Theon; Jon senses conflict is near; Brienne patiently waits for a sign; Stannis's stubborn streak prevails; Jaime tries to reconnect with family(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Hardhome. Arya makes progress in her training; Sansa meets an old friend; Jon takes to the road; Cersei's troubles pile up(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Dance of Dragons. Jon returns to the Wall; Arya runs into someone from her past; Mace visits the Iron Bank; Stannis faces a difficult decision; Daenerys oversees a celebration of athleticism(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Mother's Mercy. Stannis is on the march in the Season 5 finale. Meanwhile, Cersei seeks forgiveness; Jon faces a new challenge; Arya plots to cross a name off her list; Tyrion sees a familiar face; and Daenerys finds herself surrounded by strangers(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Red Woman. In the Season 6 premiere, Sansa and Theon are on the run from Winterfell and Bolton's soldiers; Jaime delivers bad news to Cersei on his return from Dorne; Davos sends for help from the Wall; and Daenerys explains her identity to Khal Moro as Daario and Jorah continue their search for her, while Tyrion and Varys wander the eerily empty streets of Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Home. Bran continues to train under the guidance of the Three-Eyed Raven, who warns him not to dwell too much on the past. Meanwhile, Tyrion must get creative to find encouraging news as the situation in Meereen grows more dire every day; Tommen gets advice from Jaime; Balon Greyjoy hears several proposals; Davos finally gets help from outside Castle Black; and Ramsay comes up with a new plan of self-preservation(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Oathbreaker. Bran glimpses a pivotal battle from his father's past; Daenerys learns what's in store for her at Vaes Dothrak; the High Sparrow discusses the importance of faith with Tommen; Arya crosses a threshold in her training to be No One; Varys comes up with a solution to a vexing problem; Ramsay gets a gift and news from the North(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Book of the Stranger. A disillusioned Jon is resolved to leave Castle Black, but a surprise reunion could give him a noble and urgent purpose following his reincarnation. programme.title: The Trans List
programme.desc: Notable transgender individuals, including Caitlyn Jenner, Caroline Cossey, Buck Angel and Laverne Cox, are interviewed. They candidly discuss their experiences and what it means to be transgender(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the academic and domestic staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes and quell her tomboy tendencies; it's a losing battle. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with VIctorian-style technology; where people's souls take the form of character-suggesting visible animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority over everyone. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one; one that uncovers the terrible truth that links the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in the safety of Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellen. Sadly, it now looks as though the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Part of More4's Indian week, Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Mountain and the Viper. Showrunners Dan Weiss and David Benioff unfurl a fresh tangle of gut-punching plot twists in season four of the brilliant fantasy drama, which is based largely on the back half of A Storm of Swords, the third book in George RR Martin's epic series. Mole's Town receives some unexpected visitors, and Tyrion's fate is decided(n)
